loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi, in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells general household materials. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more household materials, and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and to acquire a plot of land. Ronald hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more household materials.

loans.name: Jeninah

texts.en:
Jeninah is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Kabale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. For the past 12 years, Jeninah has been working hard to manage her grocery shop where she sells beans, groundnuts, and posho. 

Jeninah is requesting a 4,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy beans, groundnuts, and posho. Her loan will help her to generate greater profits and improve her family’s wellbeing. Jeninah hopes that she will be able to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy beans, groundnuts, and posho

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Soliya

texts.en: Soliya is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and her husband works seasonally as a constructor. She has 30 years experience of working at a secondary school. She is well known among friends and teachers. Her salary is spent on family needs like food and clothing. It is difficult to find a good job with a permanent salary in the area where they live. She and her husband decided to find more opportunity of earning money abroad. Her husband will go abroad and find work to ensure their family's future. She appealed to IMON and asked for help to take a loan to buy a ticket for her husband. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a ticket for her husband

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 34 years old and he supports six family members. He has been a farmer for the last seven years, and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which he plans to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his crops to get a better harvest and meet the needs of clients.  He plans to use gained profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his crops to get a better harvest and meet the needs of clients.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janet is a 32 years old, married to Timothy and she supports 6 family members. 

She has been a farmer for the last 7 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to purchase fertilizers and insecticides so as to get a better harvest and meet the needs of clients. 

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides so as to get a better harvest and meet the needs of her clients.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Kabale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells books, pens, papers, posho. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase books, pens, papers, posho, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and improve welbeing. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase books, pens, papers, posho and improve the welbeing of his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to carry out repairs and maintenance to his vehicle, which is currently in poor condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides, so as to get a better harvest and help pay for the education of her children.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Kabale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Rosette has been working hard to manage her bakery, which operates in baking cakes, cookies and doughnuts. 

To help expand her business, Rosette has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy yeast, blue band margarine, and will help Rosette to generate greater profits and improve well being. 

Rosette hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy yeast and other baking supplies for her doughnut business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a General store business in the Philippines.

Jessica requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell and be able to repair her family's home

loans.name: Den's Group

texts.en: Den is living in Kampong Cham province, and a mother of two children. She is ages 32 years old, and she is a cassava and rice farmer for more than ten years. Due to lack of fund, she is now leading a group to apply for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee. She hopes to earn more money to support her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her rental houses where she owns rental units. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build more rental units, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and increase her income. Agnes hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to build more rental units

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 34 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Deo has been working hard to manage his bar, where he sells sodas and local brew. 

To help expand his business, Deo has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks, and will help Deo to generate greater profits and increase family income. Deo hopes that in the future, he will be able to open up another outlet.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Kabale region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 8 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy hair dryers, oils and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and improve well being.  

Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business.

loans.use: to buy oils, braids and will improve her business, with greater profits

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man from Nablus city. He has a small restaurant where he sells light sandwiches and soft drinks. It is a very good business and provide the family with a good income.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a refrigerator and and other supplies for his restaurant. Ahmad will be able to improve his business by making fresh fruit cocktails
 
Ahmad appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and other supplies for his restaurant. He will improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock with various varieties of ready made clothes, which will stabilize her business and enable her to lead a better life

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to equip her salon with blow dryers and hair dryer machines

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en: Haydar is a 22-year-old client from Iraq.  He is married and has one child. Haydar is a tailor and he established his own workshop in 2013. He gained his experience through working at other tailor shops and built good tailoring skills. He is well known in his local area for his good quality and affordable prices. Haydar is requesting a loan of $3,000 to install signage for the shop and buy two specialized machines for his business. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install signage for the shop and buy two specialized machines for his business

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman and has been blessed with two children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a dried fish selling business for over two years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality  in her place of operations.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of dried fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of dried fish for resale, to enable her to plan to open a further business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 46 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has no children currently in school. For the past 8 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his farming business, which sells bananas. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bananas, and will help Richard to generate greater profits and increase family income. 

Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to expand on the business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, to generate greater profits and increase family income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Elmer Jeovany

texts.es: Elmer es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 6 años se dedica  a la reparación de bicicletas, actividad que le permite sostener a su familia, y estar pendiente de sus hijos. Él vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 2, 4 y 11 años de edad, que son su mayor alegría, por lo que desea brindarles siempre lo mejor que este en sus manos. Elmer ha instalado en su vivienda su taller de bicicletas, el cual es muy rentable, ya que en su municipio estas son muy utilizadas para transportarse por la poca afluencia de transporte colectivo, por lo que él solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frenos, llantas, tubo, rayos, piñones, cadenas, cuñas, pedales, cables de freno, etc.
texts.en: Elmer is a hardworking man who has worked for 6 years repairing bicycles, an activity that allows him to support his family and take care of his children. He lives with his domestic partner and their three children, who are 2, 4 and 11 years old and his greatest happiness; and this is why he wants to give them always all the best he has. In his home Elmer has installed his bicycle shop, which is very profitable, since in his municipality these are very used for transportation due to the low flow of collective transportation. This is why he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: brakes, tires, tubes, spokes, freewheels, chains, wedges, pedals, brake cables, etc.

loans.use: to invest in: brakes, tires, tubes, spokes, freewheels, chains, wedges, pedals, brake cables, etc.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Muhamad is 25 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years.  Muhamad has been working hard to manage his shoe business, which sells shoes and sandals. 

To help expand his business, Muhamad has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy raw materials for shoes, and will help Muhamad to generate greater profits and increase on income. 

Muhamad hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business.

loans.use: buy raw materials for making shoes, which will enable him to expand his business

loans.name: Srey Mom's Group

texts.en:
Srey Mom is rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She is aged 34 and the mother of three children, only two of them are in school. Nowadays, her family’s living is depending on growing rice on one hectare farmland for sixteen years and to earn additional income, she also works as a construction worker. Due to the crops not growing well, her yields were depreciated. 

Now she faced with a problem of lacking money to run the farm, so she is now leading a group to take a loan with VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. 

She hopes to grow her crops successfully and gain more yields.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, so her crops will grow well and she will make a better profit

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bicycle for transporting her produce to the market

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana ha sido una ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus 2 hijos y su esposo; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 5 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposo y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de camisetas, jeans, ropa interior y otros accesorios de vestir, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Diana manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Diana has been a very dedicated housewife who is always attentive to her family’s care.  Her family is comprised of her husband and their two children.  

She has always liked to work as an independent merchant.  She started selling merchandise five years ago.  Together with her husband, she is responsible for carrying the household’s financial burden.  She needs to generate the resources to do so.

Her customers are her neighbors, relatives, and friends in the area.  She works alone every day in her business.  Her work has the advantage of being able to be responsible for her family and managing to be a productive merchant at the same time.

She is currently requesting the loan to buy stock in bulk.  She will buy t-shirts, jeans, underwear, and clothing accessories.  It is a great opportunity during this time of year.  This will allow her to stock up with more variety to satisfy the demand.  This will produce the result of getting better earnings for her family.

Diana says that her greatest wish is to be able to continue financially supporting her family and to give all of her children an education in order to see them become professionals that have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, underwear, and clothing accessories wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add new stock of clothes to satisfy her clients and to improve the standards of her family living

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 35 years old, married and has two children. He wants to earn a living to provide for his family .  He is engaged in a piggery business. 

For 5 years already he has done this kind of business and it is a successful one.  He also gets his previous loan payment from this business. 

He wants to continue this kind of business because it helps a lot for his family needs. He decided again to take a loan to buy feed for the piglets.

Noel wants in the future to expand his business, to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy feed for his piglets, which will expand his business and sustain the needs of his family

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a married man. He is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ricardo is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Ricardo has a bread retailing business in the Philippines. Ricardo requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bread to offer for sale.

Ricardo has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ricardo would like to save enough money to expand his business and repair his family's home.

loans.use: to buy more bread to offer for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her clothing store, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and increase family income. 

Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for her store to expand her business

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is a 37-year-old married lady and the mother of four children. Her husband newly started a business.  He provides the services to wash dusty carpets. He used the various chemicals to wash the carpets which are very costly.

He is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy these chemicals. 

Majeedan wants to help to her husband financially in the form of a loan. Therefore, she reached to the nearest branch of BRAC and requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.
 
She hopes that her husband would utilize this loan in positive way and can purchase chemicals to continue his services.

Majeedan thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: 's husband in purchasing chemicals for his carpet cleaning business..

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Moises, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.

El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 6 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos.

Trabaja con un empleado todos los días durante 6 horas.

Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar una un amplio surtido de verduras y de esta manera abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad de alimentos.

Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilo y cómodamente sus alimentos.

Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en: Moises works selling fruits and vegetables. He is a man with motivation and perseverance to move his own business and family ahead. He has worked in this activity for more than six years, working every day from very early in the morning to offer his food items. He works with an employee for six hours every day. He decided to start this project when he saw the need to obtain more income for his family; and since he did not have enough education for another job, he opted for selling fruits and vegetables. He is a friendly and helpful man, always ready to help his customers with their concerns and desires. He is asking for financial help with Interactuar in order to buy an ample stock of vegetables, and in this way to stock up and sell a larger quantity of food items. His dream is to have a store where he can sell quietly and comfortably his food items. Lend and give today, go for it!

loans.use: to buy a more ample stock of vegetables, and in this way to stock up and sell a larger quantity of food items.

loans.name: Tirsa

texts.en:
Tirsa is a native from Panglao, Bohol. She sells fresh fish to the locals to earn a living. She has been engaged in the fish vending business for three years. She is married woman  with five dependents, ages 13 to 3 years old, respectively. 

She  is asking for a loan to buy a new weighing scale, a variety of fresh fish, and foam (for fish storage).  With the presence of these materials, it would really help improve Tirsa's income. She could now be able to sell a variety of fresh fish and start to balance her finances. She could now afford to buy a healthy diet for the whole family and be able to provide them with better shelter.

She is determined to expand her livelihood and hopefully she can handle another one to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a new weighing scale, a variety of fresh fish, and foam ( for fish storage)

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is 29 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  He is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past four years , Bashir has been working hard to manage his fish vending business. 

To help expand his business, Bashir has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Bashir to generate greater profits and increase capital. Bashir hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more fish

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel earns a living in a seaweed farming business. At the age of 31 years she has three children to provide for. To sustain the needs of her family she needs to expand and continue her seaweed farming to earn more income. Thats why she decided to borrowed a loan again to buy additional seaweeds for her seaweeds farming.

Jessel plan for the future to save money out from her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seaweeds.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Kabershmoun Al Huda Group

texts.en:
Huda is the featured borrower of Kabershmoun Al Huda group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they are best friends and work hard to develop their businesses in a well managed way to support their families.
Huda is a 62-year-old married mother of two, who has been working as a private nurse for thirty years to support her beloved family since she is their sole breadwinner.   Her beloved husband can't work and support his family because of a certain medical situation, which forces her to work harder and search more for extra income business.

Since her family's needs are increasing, Huda started her own shoe selling business  two months ago , and today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her newly established business merchandise with new spring and summer collections.  That will attract more customers, and increase her selling and income at the same time.

Huda is the lady at the far right side of the picture, accompanied by her two other group members, Sahar at the center with blue top, who works in handmade souvenirs business and runs a grocery store, and is requesting the loan to make necessary medical examinations for her son. While Sawsan is the lady at the far left side of the picture, who works as a tutor, and her requested loan will be invested in paying for her child's school tuition fees.

loans.use: To increase her newly established business merchandise with new spring and summer collection

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 47 years old, and he supports seven family members.  He has been a farmer for the last 13 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which he plans to purchase fertilizers and inputs for better produce. This will enable him make a great harvest and thus meet his customers' demands.
 
He plans to use the profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and inputs for better produce

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: Chreb is ages 48 years old, a mother of four children, living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, her family’s living is dependent on rice farming on two hectares of farmland. Working as a construction worker is the additional source of income for her. She could earn about 45,000KHR per day. Now she is leading a group to take a loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to gain more yields than last year and ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Thy is a rice farmer and grocery seller, living in Kampong Cham province. She is 39 years old and a mother of two children, one of whom is in school. Thy has been involved in this business for more than ten years. Due to lack of funds to do the farm, she is now leading a small group to take a new loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes her business will be expanded through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to the sewage system and improve the bathroom conditions in her home.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en: Nary has been a cassava and rice farmer for twenty-eight years, living in Kampong Cham province. She is 46 years old and a mother of four children. Her crops not growing well this year has affected her daily income, and now she hasn't enough funds to do her farming. In order to solve this problem, she decided to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund with the portion to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pay for plowing fees. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia has been raising hogs for almost 5 years now. She is 64 year old married woman with 12 grown dependents. She lives in Panglao, Bohol.  She is in need of funds to continue her hog raising activity.

Gelasia has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to purchase piglets, pig feed, and pig supplement. With these, she will be able to continue raise more hogs. With these, she could sell quality pigs and this will augment her income. Thus, she could now set aside some savings for emergency use. 

She is determined to handle it properly in order to improvement the family's status of living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, pig feed, and pig supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more modern systems for her events business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 36 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his welding business, which welds doors, windows, glasses. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw materials and iron rods, and will help Richard to generate greater profits and generate more income. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials and iron rods, to generate more profits and expand his business

loans.name: Deogracious

texts.en:
Deogracious is 32 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Deogracious has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, rice, sugar, posho. 

To help expand his business, Deogracious has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soap, rice, sugar, posho, and will help Deogracious to generate greater profits and generate more income. 

Deogracious hopes that in the future he will be able to have an expanded business.

loans.use: buy more soap, rice, sugar, posho to help expand his business

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 31 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 5 years, Dinah has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beer, drinking water and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Dinah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beers and sodas, and will help Dinah to generate greater profits and increase family total income. Dinah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a well stocked shop.

loans.use: buy more beers and sodas, so that she will have a well stocked bar for good sales

loans.name: Bara

texts.en:
Bara is a 19-years-old single young man from a village near Tulkarm city. He lives with his family in a small house. The family has a store for selling home furniture and carpets. It is a very good business and all the family cooperate together in the work. 
Bara took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new collection of carpets for the family store. this will help them to increase the sales and also the income. 
Bara appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new collection of carpets for the family store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees for this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of soda and baking flour for sale to her customers

loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en:
Savon is living in Kampong Cham province, and is the mother of six children. She is aged 54 years and she is a rice farmer for more than ten years. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group to apply for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. 

She hopes to earn more money to support her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees, which will all help support her family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and sales

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Sophy is 48 years old and a mother of two children, living in Kampong Cham province. The sources of her family’s income is from rice farming on one hectare farmland and works as a construction worker for thirty years. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles already and already paid back the loan. Due to lack of fund, she is now leading a group to take a loan again to buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to gain more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 36 years old and he supports seven family members.
 
He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which he plans to purchase fertilizers and inputs for better produce. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and inputs for better produce

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 48-years old lady, residing in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Earlier her husband was running a furniture shop in which he had been manufacturing wooden furniture such as chairs, table, almira and beds. He has been teaching the arts for furniture making to his both sons. Now, both her sons are very expert in manufacturing furniture. They make the furniture and then polish the furniture for finishing. Polish increases the shine, grace, and value of furniture.
The demand for manufacturing suddenly increased, and her sons have spent all the money to buy raw materials. Now they do not have enough cash in hand left to buy furniture polish.
Therefore, Gulshan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her sons can be able to buy the necessary inventory.
Gulshan is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support

loans.use: to help her sons in purchasing furniture polish for making furniture.

loans.name: Mohrugul

texts.ru:
На районе Джоми живет женщина по именем Мохругул. Она на районе живет давно. Мохругул очень давно начала занимается куплю продажей крупнорогатого скота. 20 лет уже она продвигает свою деятельность. Мохругул во дворе выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Она опытная и сильная женщина своей работе. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что  доход от этой деятельностью обеспечить ее семью. 
Мохругул семейная женщина. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, потому что он в родине без работы. Он решил заниматься разнорабочим загранице, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить семью и детей. У Мохругул четверых детей. Ей в работе помогает дети. Мохругул хочет расширить животноводческую  деятельность, путем увеличения поголовье скота. С такими надеждами Мохругул обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: In the region of Jomi lives a woman named Mohrugul. She has lived there for a long time. Mohrugul has been buying and selling cattle for 20 years. Mohrugul raises cattle on her farm. She is experienced and strong. Raising cattle is fundamental, because the income Mohrugul makes from it supports her family. Mohrugul's husband works in Russia, because he couldn't find work at home. He decided to work as a laborer abroad to earn money to support his family. Mohrugul has four children, who help her with the work. Mohrugul wants to expand her livestock business by increasing her herd and has therefore applied for a loan.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase her livestock herd

loans.name: Gorge William

texts.en:
Gorge William is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. 

For the past 3 years, Gorge William has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar,soap,bread,eggs,soap. 

To help expand his business, Gorge William has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar,soap,bread,eggs,soap, and will help Gorge William to generate greater profits and increase stock. 

Gorge William hopes that in the future he will be able to become the best supplier.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, bread, eggs, soap for his store.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Medina has been working hard to manage her school. 

To help expand her business, Medina has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build more school structures, and will help Medina to generate greater profits and expand the business. 

Medina hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big shop.

loans.use: to build more school structures at her school.

loans.name: Oday 1 Group

texts.en:
Sawsan is the featured borrower for Oday 1 Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Sawsan is a 33-year-old Syrian married lady. Due to the low financial situation of her family, she decided to help her husband in improving their living condition, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a beauty care business from her house and she wants to buy cosmetics and make ups. She hopes to succeed with her ten years of experience in attracting a lot of customers and satisfying their needs. Sawsan is the first lady on the right of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Riham is 21-year-old who wants to prepare for her wedding, while Mayssam is a 23-year-old who wants to pay for her driving license. Riham is the first lady on the left, and Mayssam is the lady standing in the middle.

loans.use: to start a beauty care business and to buy cosmetics and make up

loans.name: Julio Ernesto

texts.es: Julio cuenta con 47 años de edad y vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijas de 14 y 2 años de edad, en vivienda propia. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios en una empresa cercana, pero además buscando darle siempre lo mejor a su familia decidió instalar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su vivienda, la cual es administrada por su compañera de vida. Julio desea invertir en mercadería para su tienda, ya que sabe que entre más productos tenga para ofrecer mejores serán sus ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: jabón, detergente, pan dulce, leche, huevos, crema, queso, chocolate, etc., para surtir su tienda de productos básicos.
texts.en: Julio is 47 years old. He lives with his life partner and their 2 daughters ages 14 and 2 in a home they own. He is very hard working and he makes a living offering his services to a company near by his home, but in order to provide his family with a better future, he decided to set up a general store out of his home, which is managed by his partner. Julio would like to invest in new products for his store, as he knows that the more products he carries the better his profit will be. For this reason, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy soap, detergent, fruit cake, milk, eggs, cream, cheese, chocolate, etc., to stock his store with basic products.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, fruit cake, milk, eggs, cream, cheese, chocolate, etc., to stock his store with basic products.

loans.name: Isima

texts.en:
Isima is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi, in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, Isima has been working hard to manage his clothing boutique. 

To help expand his business, Isima has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Isima to generate greater profits and increase his family's income. 

Isima hopes that in the future he will be able to have a big shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Cristy Lou

texts.en:
Cristy Lou runs a vending business for a living., She has a small grocery stall. At the aged of 33, she has three children to provide for. This is why she decided to expand her business and have more stocks. 

She decided again to take a loan to purchase goods for selling and be able to increase her stall inventory and generate more income to provide for her family's daily needs.

Cristy Lou wants in the future to save money from her business to have a store building of her own.

loans.use: To purchase a larger amount of goods to sell, which will generate more income and provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is 42 years old and supports a family of 5 members. She has been operating a retail business for the last 6 years earning a monthly income of KES 5,500. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to increase her stock so as to satisfy her clients for more income gain and improve her family living standards. 

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to increase her stock so as to satisfy her clients for more income gain and improve her family living standards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and inputs for increased production when harvest comes, to meet the demands of his clients

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
Al hablar de José se puede evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.

El vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de Sincelejo donde convive con su esposa y dos hijas por las cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una buena educación.

El se gana la vida con la compra y venta de cerdos de engorde y tiene plena fe en su negocio.

Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de su familia.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar 2 cerdos grandes ya que requiere capitalizar su negocio para tener un amplio inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario y puede contar en pleno con el apoyo de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
When talking about José, you can see that he is a very hard-working and helpful man. Everything that he does is for the good and well-being of his family. He lives in a humble house in the town of Sincelejo, where he lives with his wife and two daughters for whom he has fought to give a dignified life and a good education. 

He makes a living by purchasing and selling fattened pigs and he has full faith in his business. He is a working individual, incessant and very fond of his family. 

He is asking for a loan to buy 2 large pigs to capitalize on his business and have an ample inventory available to sell to his clients. He hopes to be able to find help from people with caring hearts and to be able to have full support from the Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy 2 large pigs to capitalize on his business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar,soap,cold drinks,beer. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 4.000.000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar,soap,cold drinks,beer, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and increase family income. 

Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big shop.

loans.use: buy more sugar, soap, cold drinks, beer for her store, to generate greater profits

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Thank you for your tender hearts and helping hands. Through you, Raquel has enabled herself to buy more supplies and products for her store which have helped her to increase her profits. With this increase, she was able to better support her family's daily living expenses. 

But her dream of growing into progress doesn't stop there, she still wants to improve her business. To gain more income, she would like to ask again for a 12,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy more groceries, toiletries, and beverages for her store. If she continues to utilize this financial assistance, this could be a good head start for her to finally expand her chosen trade. 

Raquel meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Tundy Group

texts.es:
Brigida es una mujer de 30 años, soltera, tiene un hijo de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, amable, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Tundy’ situada a una distancia de 25 kilómetros al sur este de la ciudad, sus pobladores se dedican principalmente a labores agropecuarias, los jóvenes y niños pasan rápidamente a un espacio laboral para poder apoyar a sus familias, Normalmente los trabajos que desempeñan están relacionados a labores en los chacos, cuidado de ganado y en algunos casos niñeras o ayudante de albañiles en la ciudad. 
Brigida es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada a la derecha). Su vida la comparte con su pequeño hijo que se inicia en la escuela, viven en una casa construida de palos de madera con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica para conseguir agua los niños deben ir al rio a recogerla. Su deseo de darle un futuro mejor a su hijo la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; comercio de gallinas, lavandería, venta de jugos, venta de sombreros, tienda de barrio, agricultura, venta de leche y comercio de madera, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui),  sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), y otros, “la comida que preparamos es fresca con alimentos que nosotros producimos eso le da un sazón propio del lugar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes llegan de la ciudad a buscar comida fresca y por ello cuenta con muchos clientes, la desventaja es la falta de muebles y materiales de cocina para expandir su negocio. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea realizar la compra de muebles de restaurante como; mesas, sillas, banquetas y sombrillas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de manera continua.
Es por esos motivos que Brigida solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles para abrir un restaurante.
texts.en: Brigida is a 30 year old woman. She is single and has a 5 year old son. Her business is selling traditional food. She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, kind, optimistic, responsible and very hard working. She has her business in the ‘Tundy’ community, located 25 kilometers southeast of the city. Its inhabitants work mainly in farming activities. The youth and children start working rapidly in order to support their families. Normally, these jobs are related to jobs in the Chacos (pastures), taking care of cattle, and in some cases as nannies or construction helpers in the city. Brigida is of dark skin, with brown eyes, long black hair which she uses tied, short, stocky. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks in her town, and Spanish as general culture and for her business (she is seated on the right)  She shares her life with her small son, who has started school. They live in a house, built with wooden sticks, with corrugated iron roof and electricity. In order to get water, the children must go to the river to get it. Her wish to give her son a better life made her form a group of people with businesses such as: sale of hens, laundry, sale of juices, sale of hats, grocery store, agriculture, sale of milk and sale of wood, in order to request a loan and improve their businesses. Her business is selling traditional food such as: locro carretero cruceño (soup made of dehydrated meat, meat cut in small chunks, cassava and egg), Cogote relleno (creole chicken neck, stuffed with potato and "churiqui"), peanut soup (soup made with a peanut based broth), stuffed "locotos" (bell peppers, chopped meat, onions), rice with cheese (rice, milk and cheese), and other foods. "The food we prepare is fresh with ingredients we produce, and this gives it an original, local taste...", she comments. The advantage of her business is that her customers come to the city to look for fresh food and because of this she has many customers. The disadvantage is the lack of furniture and kitchen materials to expand her business. Her dream is to open a restaurant. She wants to buy restaurant furniture such as: tables, chairs, benches and parasols. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years she has been working in this job continuously. These are the reasons why Brigida is requesting a loan to buy furniture to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy furniture in order to open a restaurant.

loans.name: Reina Isabel Constanza

texts.es:
Reina, de 25 años de edad, estudio solo cuarto grado, debido a la situación económica no pudo continuar estudiando; actualmente está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, tienen 3 hijos, todos están estudiando en la escuela.

Reina, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 10 años de edad, fue con su padre que aprendió todo, pero ademá, tiene una pequeña granja de cerdos y su pareja compra y vende ganado.- La necesidad y el deseo de sacar a sus hijos adelante, es la que los impulsa a hacer todo lo que hacen.

Reina, junto a su pareja siembran maíz, pipían, ajonjolí y maicillo, todo lo siembran a 1 kilómetro y medio de su casa, ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para preparar el desayuno y prepara todo para que sus hijos vayan a la escuela, después ella y su pareja salen a trabajar al campo hasta las 11:00 a.m. pues tiene que preparar el almuerzo y cuidar sus hijos.


El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar semilla, abono y veneno para sembrar, porque ya se acerca el invierno y tiene que prepara la tierra.

Su sueño es, ver a sus hijos graduarse de una carrera profesional, además sueña con tener una casa de ladrillo, porque en donde viven es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Reina is 25 years old. She only went to school until the fourth grade. Due to the economic situation she could not continue studying. Now she is married and her husband makes a living in agriculture and cattle raising. They have 3 children who are all in school. Reina has worked in agriculture since she was 10 years old. She learned everything from her father, but she also has a small pig farm and her husband buys and sells cattle. 

The need and the desire to get their children ahead is what boosts them to do everything that they do. Reina and her husband plant corn, pumpkin, sesame and sorghum. They plant everything 1 and a half kilometers from their house. She gets up at 4:30 a.m. to prepare breakfast and prepare everything for her kids to go to school. Afterwards, she and her husband go to work in the field until 11:00 a.m. because she has to prepare lunch and take care of her kids. 

The loan that she is asking for is to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for planting, because winter is coming and she has to prepare the land. Her dream is to see her children graduate with a professional career. She also dreams of having a brick house because the one they live in is made of mud.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for planting.

loans.name: Aeda

texts.en:
Aeda is a 41-year-old married woman who has one son. She is a conservative woman and asked her son to take her place in the photo. Aeda is working with a low income, and she wishes to see her only son graduate and find good work with a good salary.

Aeda requested an education loan for her son`s university fees because of the financial crises that she has experienced. Her son is studying water resources management. She needs your help to see her son become a successful and professional man in the future by paying for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: Alexa

texts.es:
La  Joven  Alexa de22 años de edad  es casada   y se dedica a la venta  abarrotería y refrescos y su negocio está ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle sus clientes son todas las personas y amigos que la visitan así como  turistas que la visitan los cuales le prefieren  por ser un persona muy amable.
Doña Alexa ofrece a su público todo lo que es producto de la canasta básica también vende lo que es almuerzo y golosinas, es conocida por ser una persona luchadora y joven está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio comprando  margarina, manteca, jabón, arroz, refrescos, agua, leche, huevos, harina, etc. Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar mas sus ingresos y mejorar aun mas su vivienda.
Su sueño es tener más surtido su negocio y tener una mejor condición de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Abril del 2015.
texts.en:
Alexa is 22 years old. She is married and she owns a store where she sells groceries and sodas and her business is located in the community of San Lorenzo, her clients are neighbors and friends who visit her and tourists who choose to go to her for her kindness.
Alexa offers every basic product to her customers. She also sells lunch and candy. She is well known as a hard working young woman, and she is asking for a loan to stock her store with soap, detergent, fruit cake, milk, eggs, cream, cheese, chocolate, etc. With her profits and the backing for this loan she hopes to make further improvements to her home.
Her dream is to have a larger stock variety and have a better quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Abril del 2015.

loans.use: to buy margarine, butter, soap, rice, sodas, water, milk, eggs, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Con su gran empuje y perseverancia, Juan ha salido adelante y ha podido educar y sostener a su familia conformada por 2 hijos y su esposa.
Siempre ha buscado la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia, tanto así que ha pasado por numerosos trabajos en el municipio de Sincelejo.

Hoy en día, después de haber decidido por su independencia, trabaja en la fabricación de artículos y objetos artesanales en el material llamado cañaflecha.

Por esta y muchas más razones solicita un préstamo para compra materia prima como cañaflecha e insumos como agujas y pegas.
Con este préstamo podrá asegurar la sostenibilidad de su negocio y por ende de su familia.

Si prestas a este crédito estarás aportando al progreso y empuje Colombiano!
texts.en:
With his big drive and perseverance, Juan has gotten ahead and has been able to educate and support his family, formed by 2 children and his wife. He has always looked for the way to get income for his family, so much so that he has gone through many jobs in the town of Sincelejo. 

Nowadays, after having decided on independence, he manufactures articles and crafts with the material called wild cane. For this and many more reasons, he is asking for a loam to buy raw material such as wild cane and supplies such as needles and glue. With this loan he will be able to assure the sustainability of his business and thus of his family. 

If you give to this loan, you will be contributing to the Colombian progress and drive!

loans.use: to buy raw material such as wild cane and supplies such as needles and glue.

loans.name: Seansamlan Group

texts.en: Seesomphone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Seesomphone and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Seesomphone and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years filter users, like Seesomphone’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 47 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos, dos están estudiando y el otro todavía no por su poca edad.

 José es un campesino agricultor, además se dedica a elaborar petates junto con su esposa.

 Él necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y para pagar mano de obra para la siembra de granos básicos.

Su mayor deseo es tener sanos sus cultivos, prosperar económicamente y así poder darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old. He has a wife and 3 children. Two of them are in school and the third is still too young to attend.
José is a farmer and he also makes mats alongside his wife.
He needs a loan to buy farming supplies and to pay for labor to plant basic grains.
His biggest wish is to have healthy crops, to thrive financially and be able to give his children the best.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay for labor to  plant basic grains.

loans.name: Nonsomboun Group

texts.en: Aon understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Aon knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Aon purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent on charcoal and decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Aon is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 49 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past five years, Penina has been working hard to operate a hardware shop. 

To help expand her business, Penina has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy nails, cement, and lime, and will help Penina to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Penina hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her business stock.

loans.use: to buy nails, cement, and lime

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 56 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his tailoring, where he sews clothes. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials like threads, cloth, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and growth in business. 

Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy materials like threads and cloth, to achieve a greater profit and expand his business

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 47 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years,  Fredrick has been working hard to manage his piggery, which rears piglets. 

To help expand his business,  Fredrick has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase the number of pigs and will help Fredrick to generate greater profits and growth in business.  

Fredrick hopes that in the future he will be able to expand and buy more cows.

loans.use: increase the number of pigs, to generate more profit

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford is 38 years old and he supports 6 family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya which he plans to purchase fertilizers and inputs for better produce.

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and inputs for better produce, which will expand his agricultural sector

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida would like you to know her full appreciation and thanksgiving because her previous loan has indeed helped her in buying additional products for her business. She faithfully repaid an amount of PHP 45,000 which she had used in buying additional products for her inventory. 

But still, she would like to improve her sales more. With this, she is humbly requesting for another PHP 50,000 which she will utilize to purchase more merchandise products like crackers, "balut" (fertilized duck eggs), and other food items to offer for sale. Preferably, her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. 

In some time at the future, she wants to succeed in life and be able to earn for her children's education. If they finish studies someday, it will be a great security for better lives ahead. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy eggs, crackers,"balut" (fertilized duck eggs), and other food items for sale, which will enable her children to finish their studies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth 39 years old and supports a family of 4 members. She has been operating a food stall business for the last 6 years earning a monthly income of KES 5,500. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to add new stock of green vegetables, tomatoes and other groceries for resale.

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to add new stock of green vegetables, tomatoes and other groceries for resale.  This will better her life

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
Marietha owns and operates a sari-sari store. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her small variety store.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 25,000 to buy products like grocery items for her store. 

Marietha hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 50-year-old mother of two children. Her husband earns a low income.

Manal wants to exploit her free time with something useful, so she decided to be a productive woman and work in the field that she loves to help her husband with the household expenses. 

She started sewing clothes. When she felt that she was working well and was earning a good income, she decided to expand her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help develop her work and buy fabrics and supplies to sew more products and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies to sew more products and increase her income

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with six children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour so as to boost her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cashew seeds to store and sell in the winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of eggs for resale

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is married with four school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga (wrap cloth for women) business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale

loans.name: Oslardo Jose

texts.es:
Oslardo es un hombre trabajador, humilde y muy trabajador, cualidades que tiene muy bien merecidas ya que su labor de zapatero le han dado la oportunidad de conseguir el sustento para su familia.

Inicio este negocio hace 15 años a través de las enseñanzas de un amigo quien le ofreció la oportunidad de aprender el oficio y le dio las herramientas para que pudiera montar su propio negocio.
Tiene un pequeño taller de zapatería en su casa en el municipio de Chinu.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar materia prima como cuero, pega, clavos, entre otros, elementos que le permitirán abastecer su negocio y poder generar una mejor producción de calzado.

Ayuda a Oslardo a cumplir su sueño de darle una buena educación a sus hijos a través de su trabajo!
texts.en:
Oslardo is a hard working, humble man. These are qualities he has earned thanks to his skills as a shoe maker which has given him the chance to support his family.
He started this business 15 years ago thanks to the mentoring from a friend who gave him the chance to learn this trade and the tools to set up this business. He established a small shoe shop out of his home in the municipality of Chinu.
He is asking for financial support to buy raw material such as leather, glue, nails, and others, to stock his business and develop a better shoe production.
Please help Oslardo fulfill his dream of providing his children with a good education through his work!

loans.use: to buy raw material such as leather, glue, nails, and others, to stock his business and develop a better shoe production.

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en:
Ton is ages 60 years old, and he is a father of four children and living in Kampong Cham province. Cassava farming and working for other farm are the sources of his family’s income for forty one years. Through these businesses, he could earn about 31,000KHR per day.

Now he is leading a group to take a new loan with VisionFund to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees. He hopes to gain more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for plowing fees, with increased yields this season

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania lives in southern Ghour; she is 24 year, married and mother of one small child. 

Rania decided to open her business after she had child, and her husband became unable to cover the household expenses, and because she believed that the life is participation in all aspects she started to sell clothes and blankets in her home to help her husband.

Rania is running her project, and the problem that she is facing is low liquidity, therefore she applied for a youth loan to buy more clothes and products to sell. 

Rania future plan is to expand the project to become a shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and products to sell, which will improve the family living conditions

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en: Nam is 61 years old, lives in Kampong Thom province, and is a mother of five children. She has been a rice farmer for thirty years to earn money to support her family’s living. This is the third loan for her with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The previous loans helped her to have enough consumption to use. Now she is leading a group to apply for a loan to buy a decent latrine. She hopes all her family members will have good health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Motaz

texts.en:
Motaz is a 31-year-old married man from Dier Al Balah. He is a father of two small kids. Motaz has a store selling home products that he opened three years ago. It is a good business and the demand is high. 

Motaz took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Motaz will be able to improve his business and expand it in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sacks of maize grains for sale

loans.name: Sayram

texts.en:
Everything is going really well right now for Sayram. She is very happy that you helped with her financial difficulties. Thanks to you she now has work. She has been planting crops consistently for six years and works only in agriculture. Working on the land is hard but Sayram doesn't worry about that because she receives income from this occupation.

This year Sayram has planted potatoes. She wants to use the loan amount to purchase fertilizers. She hasn't been able to save up enough money to amend the soil and fertilize her crops on her own, and so she is hoping to receive a loan. She trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Noura

texts.en:
Noura is a 39-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working in selling and renting special occasion dresses since 2003, to support her husband in covering their family's needs and developing their living. Noura is well known in her region with her special quality products and encouraging set prices to help make her customers' dreams come true. 

Her income is just good enough to cover her family's needs, but limits her from expanding her business and increasing her capital. For this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer special occasion dresses.

She hopes that in the future she can benefit from another loan which she will invest in decorating her shop.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer special occasion dresses

loans.name: Sayorahon

texts.en:
Sayorahon is a confident woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has three children. She has 30 years' experience working in a secondary school as a teacher. 

She is sick now, and needs to get treatment in the hospital. She wants to be healthy and continue her teaching to students. 

Sayorahon is requesting financial support from Kiva lenders to get treatment in the hospital. She hopes to be supported and to be treated in order to be useful teaching students.

loans.use: to get treatment in the hospital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase efficient hammers and chisels

loans.name: Kun's Group

texts.en:
Kun is living in a rural area of Kratie province. She is the age of 55 years old and a mother of seven children; only two of them are in school. The sources of her family’s income are from cassava and rice farming and working for other farms to get a fee. 

This is the first loan for her with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for labor fees. She hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer es un joven de 19 años de edad, está soltero y no tiene hijos, él vive alquilando con un amigo suyo pues no vive con sus padres.

Cada mañana Elmer sale a vender pan en su motocicleta, él compra cierta cantidad de pan y luego lo vende con el objetivo de sacar cierto margen de ganancias.

Él necesita este crédito para reparar su motocicleta, ya que es su medio de transporte para salir a vender pan.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a formar su hogar, tener casa propia y poner una panadería.
texts.en:
Elmer is a young man of 19 years of age.  He is single and does not have children.  He lives renting with a friend, since he does not live with his parents.  

Each morning Elmer goes out to sell bread on his motorcycle.  He buys a certain quantity of bread and then he sells it with the objective of making a certain profit margin.  

He needs this loan to repair his motorcycle, since it is his means of transportation to go out to sell bread.

His greatest dream is to set up home, to have his own house and to set up a bakery.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle, since is it his means of transportation to go out to sell bread.

loans.name: Sophon's Group

texts.en:
Sophon is the age of 65 years. She is a mother of three children, and only one of them is in school. She is living in Mondulkiri province. She has grown cassava and worked on other farms for a fee to support her family’s living for six years. 

Due to lack of funds to do the farm, she is now leading a group to apply for a loan with VisionFund to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to have better living conditions through this loan.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee

loans.name: Carmen Enith

texts.es:
Carmen, a sus 47 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, el oficio lo aprendió de una amiga y poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en su casa y con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas. 

Trabaja sola todos los días durante varias horas, dependiendo de la cantidad de trabajo que tenga trabaja con otra persona; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar. 

El crédito que solicita en apoyo con la Corporación Interactuar es para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará elementos como tela, agujas, hilos, botones, entre otros, con los que podrá aumentar su capacidad de producción.

Carmen manifiesta que su mayor desafío es el alto costo de los insumos para trabajar, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Carmen, at 47 years of age, is a strong and hard-working woman; she always is in search of alternatives that will allow her to progress.  

She has made a living in the field of dressmaking for 10 years.  She learned the craft from a friend and little by little perfected her technique and expanded her knowledge through practice.  This pushed her to begin her own shop, for which she adapted a space in her house and with some savings that she had, bought her first machines.

She works alone every day for several hours; depending on the quantity of work that she has, she works with another person.  In this way she has managed to generate sufficient funds to pay for household expenses.

The loan that she requests with the Corporación Interactuar is for the strengthening of her work, since with this money she will buy items such as fabric, needles, thread, buttons, and other things, with which she will be able to increase her production capacity.

Carmen says that her greatest challenge is the high cost of the materials to work.  However, this continues to motivate her to continue to provide a better service and to fight until that dream of accreditation of her business becomes reality and she is able to generate more employment opportunities.  In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of the people who influence her work.

loans.use: to buy items such as fabric, needles, thread, buttons, and more, with which she will be able to increase her production capacity.

loans.name: Buraima

texts.ru: Бурайма успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Бураймы на сегодня есть 4 коровы, 7 овец. На 20 Га арендованной земли она выращивает кукурузу для реализации. также есть мини столовая, где Бурайма продает самсы, пирожки, пряники. Ежемесячный доход Бураймы составляет около 17,000 сом (KGS).
