For the past two years, she has operated a home-based motorcycle spare parts business and she sells to motorcycle operators. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

She wants to purchase spare parts and joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase  spare parts for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Sè Yë Dör Skíme Group

texts.es: Éste grupo de señoras organizadas se llama Banco Mujer Sè Yë Dör Skíme, escogieron el nombre en dialecto bribrí y significa "Que mi Padre me ayude", ya que todas pertenecen a una misma religión y comentan que primero Dios ante todo y que él les va ayudar a salir adelante. Son de la comunidad llamada Shiroles y es reserva indígena, todas las integrantes son indígenas. Se lograron organizar hace meses porque tienen interés en ser financiadas para reforzar las diferentes actividades productivas que emprenden. Trabajadoras y con visión empresarial. Buscan los mismos objetivos en común, el principal es crecer personalmente y en la actividad económica, asi generar ingresos a los hogares y mejorar la calidad de vida. Doña Yiselda es la secretaria del Banco Mujer, casada y madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad. Dos estudian en primaria y uno está cursando la secundaria. Es extranjera, tiene más de diez años de vivir en Costa Rica. Hace varios años se dedica al comercio ambulante de cosméticos naturales y le va muy bien, por el buen trato y facilidad que le brinda a sus clientes. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia. Inició su actividad con la finalidad de ayudar en su hogar con los gastos, debido a que su esposo cuenta con un salario fijo pero siempre hace falta para cubrir algunas necesidades familiares. Ésta conformado por siete socias, algunas van a invertir en comercio y otras en cria de pollos para vender en la misma comunidad.
texts.en: This organized group of women is called Sè Yë Dör Skíme women's bank. They chose this name in the Bribrí dialect, which means "Father help me," since they all belong to the same religion and they say that God is first before all, and that he helps them to get ahead. They are from a community called Shiroles and it is an indigenous reserve, all of its members are indigenous. They managed to organize themselves months ago because they had the interest of having financing to strengthen their different businesses that they undertake. They are hardworking with entrepreneurial vision. They seek the same objectives in common. The primary one is to grow personally and in their businesses, in this way generating income for their households and improving their quality of life. Yiselda is the secretary of the women's bank. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are minors. Two go to primary school and one is in secondary school. She is a foreigner, and has been living in Costa Rica for more than ten years. For some years, she has worked as a street vendor of natural cosmetics and it is going very well for her, due to the good treatment and terms that she offers her customers. She has her family's support. She began the work with the goal of helping in the household with the expenses, because her husband has a fixed salary but it always falls short of covering some of the family necessities. It is made up of seven members, some will invest in trade and others in raising chickens to sell in the same community.

loans.use: to purchase natural cosmetics.

loans.name: Luis Rafael

texts.es:
En la cría de aves encuentran muchas personas una gran oportunidad de vida y desarrollo, tal es el caso de Luis que con sus 50 años tiene un pequeño negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde, los cuales alimenta para venderlos posteriormente.

Vive en el municipio de Chinu donde comparte su vida con 5 hijos y su esposa.
Son una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora y sincera.

En los ojos de este campesino se refleja el esfuerzo y el pasar de los años con un gran corazón y con enseñanzas para sus hijos.

Solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de gallinas, pollos y alimento para los mismo, de este forma lograra aumentar su producción y mejorar su capital de trabajo para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Many people find a great opportunity for quality of life and growth in raising birds. This is the case for Luis who, at 50 years old, has a small business raising laying hens and chickens for fattening which he feeds to sell later. He lives in the town of Chinu where he shares his life with his 5 children and his wife. They are a humble family, but very sincere and hard workers.  Strength, the passing of years with a big heart and lessons for his children are reflected in the eyes of this farmer. He is seeking economic support to purchase hens, chickens and food for them to be able to increase his production and improve his working capital to offer his family improved economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase hens, chickens and food for them to be able to increase his production.

loans.name: Briyith Johana

texts.es:
Briyith es una mujer emprendedora de 21 años de edad, madre de una hija de 4 meses y convive con su compañero sentimental en unión libre. 

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operaria de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansada de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su hija, decidió emprender su propio taller de confección, para lo cual se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de una maquina fileteadora y una plana. 

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado. 

Con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo siempre de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar
texts.en:
Briyith is an enterprising, 21-year-old woman, mother of a 4-month-old daughter, and lives with her significant other in a common-law marriage.                      

During her productive life, she has worked at different tailoring workshops as a machine operator, reason why she has experience and knowledge in managing these types of businesses but, tired of working at other workshops and with the intention of spending more time with her daughter, she decided to embark on her own tailoring workshop for which she is motivated to request the loan. It will be invested in the purchase of an overlock and tabletop sewing machines. This will allow her to implement her productive project with which she expects to create a good impact in the sector so that it generates a favourable profitability and thus achieve her dream of positioning herself in the market.   

With her drive and ambition, she projects herself in a medium-term future generating employment, always by the hand of Corporación Interactuar [Interactuar Corporation].

loans.use: to buy an overlock and tabletop sewing machines for her production.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is a 48-year-old married father with one child. He is driver in a company and covers the needs and expenses of his family. His limited salary is not enoughto cover the  increasing costs of daily living.

Basem's daughter is his priority, he deprives himself and sacrifices to satisfy her needs. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his daughter's school tuition fees. 

Basem hopes to continue to provide his family with good living conditions. He  tries his best to build a better future for his daughter.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's  tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a strong woman who was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She lives in a remote district with her family. 

She is married and has three children. She raises livestock and wants to do open a new business but needs a loan to start a new business. 

She participated in a three-day training session provided by IMON for startup clients. She received enough information to start her business. She wants to sell children’s wear and requests a loan from KIVA lenders to buy clothing to her business. 

She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy  children’s clothing.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a fish vendor from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. She has been engaged in selling fish for more than 10 years. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 6.

She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of fish and ice. These will enable Marita to improve her sales. Thus, she could settle her obligations and handle her finances. She could afford to buy nutritious meals for the whole family.

Marita dreams of expanding her fish-vending business to become sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of fish and ice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farming by applying modern farming technology to gain more income and raise family living standards.

loans.name: Tati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of new Ruma agents, Tati. 

Tati lives in Cilegon, located about two hour’s drive from Jakarta, with her husband and her two children (one son and one daughter). She works as a teacher at one school near her house. 

She joined Ruma because she wants to learn about how to start up a business, as well as give more contribution to her community. Right now, she is becoming a mobile airtime credits provider to her community. Her community sees her as a trusted and friendly mobile provider.

With support and encouragement from Ruma’s staff, now Tati sees a lot of improvements in her business. As the business grows, she is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. 

She will use the capital to process more mobile payment services for her community, so her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. As seen in the photo, Tati is the one who is smiling. She will be thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour,  and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour,  and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, oats, French bread, beans, eggs, cheese, cream, sweet bread, etc. for her sale of atoles [cornflour drinks] and stuffed breads.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 30-year-old married mother of three children. She was 15 years old when she started studying beauty care in an institute. 

When she got married, she decided to open a beauty salon in her house to help her husband, who traveled outside Lebanon for a better job. Together, Rasha and her husband are trying to satisfy their children's needs.
 
Today, Rasha is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by obtaining a driving license and maintaining her husband's car, which will help her visit new customers in their houses. 

Rasha hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to obtain a driving license and maintain her husband's car in order to visit new customers.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is married and has five children. Two of her children, ages 13 and 10, are still attending school.

Calixta operates a t-shirt printing business. She has been engaged in this business for almost 12 years now. 

Calixta is asking for a loan to buy printing materials like ink. With these, she could cater the orders of her respective customers. She could continue to operate and this will improve her earnings. Thus, she could be able to finance the schooling of her children and provide other basic needs.

She dreams of expanding her t-shirt printing business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy printing materials like ink.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over four years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operations.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Komilahon

texts.ru: Комилахон, 51 год, замужем, 2 детей. Она, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи- занимается продажей овощей и фруктов на рынке. Картофель, кукурузу для реализации она выращивает сама на 0,45 Га земли. Благодаря упорному труду Комилахон, ее ежемесячный доход составляет до 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Комилахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Она является участником группы "Оомат-3", в которой кроме нее состоит еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита Комилахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и покупку грузового автомобиля для бизнеса.
texts.en: Komilahon, 51, is a married mother of two. Her primary source of income is selling fruits and vegetables at the local market. She also grows potatoes and corn on her 0,45 HA plot of land. Through her hard work, she has a monthly income of up to 30,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Komilahon is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale. Komilahon is part of the Oomat-3 group, which consists of three borrowers. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and purchasing a truck.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Muntamah

texts.en:
Muntamah lives in Kudus, located east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, a nine-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. 

Muntamah owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits for her community. Muntamah is known by her neighbors as a cheerful and kind woman; that’s why it’s really easy for her to attract customers. She began to realize that she needs to help her husband to improve their life by increasing their income. Therefore, almost a year ago, she decided to join Ruma and provide the services that allow her customers to buy mobile phone credits.

As the business grows, Muntamah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Muntamah improve her business and her community, which needs access to such services.

She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is from Kananga, Leyte. She is 49 years old and has three children, ages 10, 12 and 15. 

Merlita has been raising hogs for a living. This is her means to help her husband augment their income. However, Merlita once stopped after selling the fattened hogs. 

She is asking a loan to continue her business. She will use the loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements, as well as hard wood, galvanized iron and nails to repair her barn. 

Merlita is confident that, with the loan, she can start again and become a better partner to her husband in supporting their children. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger piggery business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements, as well as hard wood, galvanized iron and nails to repair her barn.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 45-year-old woman from Kananga, Leyte. She is married and her two children are both adults. 

Erlinda and her husband work hard for their daily needs. He farms vegetables and rice and also does carpentry work to earn a living. 

Erlinda helps by raising hogs and selling snacks like suman (a rice cake made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed in banana leaves), which is a favorite of the locals. 

She would like to expand her businesses of six years. She is asking a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed, cooking oil, flour, yeast, sticky rice and sugar. Currently, she usually earns 10,000 PHP per month and she hope to earn more with the help of a loan. 

Her profit will be used for healthful meals and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, cooking oil, flour, yeast, sticky rice and sugar.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, age 38, is a resident of Hoima, Uganda, with his wife and five children, three of whom are attending school. 

He used the previous loan to buy sugar and salt to offer for sale. He is still in a retail business that has enabled him get tangible benefits to support his family and pay school fees for his children, despite the problem of price fluctuations. 

He will use the loan to buy sodas, plastics, maize flour and other items to sell.

Richard is longing for capital that will help him start up a poultry project for his wife so that the family does not depend on the retail shop only.

loans.use: to buy sodas, plastics, maize flour and other items to sell.

loans.name: Winner's School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Margaret. She is the head teacher of Winner's Junior School, a mixed school in the urban area of Nyendo, in Masaka, with 350 students. 

Winner's School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Winner's School will repay the loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Margaret ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Муслима, 51 год, замужем, есть сын. Она, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи- занимается продажей зелени, овощей и фруктов на рынке. Картофель, кукурузу для реализации она выращивает сама на 0,45 Га земли. Благодаря упорному труду Муслимы, ее ежемесячный доход составляет до 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара в обороте. Муслима является участником группы "Оомат-3", в которой кроме нее состоит еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Muslima, 51, is married and has a son. Her primary source of income is selling herbs, fruits and vegetables at the local market. She also grows potatoes and corn on her 0,45 HA plot of land. Through her hard work, she has a monthly income of up to 17,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Hoping to expand her business, Muslima is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale. Muslima is part of the Oomat-3 group, which consists of three borrowers. The profit will help her to expand her business and to finish renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Erlinda Ruth

texts.es: Erlinda  tiene 36 años de edad soltera con un hijo joven que cursa estudios superiores. Hace seis años ella decide abrir su bodega en su propio domicilio paralelo a su negocio también proporciona alimentos a obreros de construcción que se encuentran por su zona. Y es de esta manera que Erlinda genera sus propios ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios. El mayor anhelo de Erlinda es comprar un lote en la ciudad para mejorar la calidad de vida. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercadería de abarrotes para su bodega. Está muy contenta de haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva.
texts.en:
Erlinda is a single, 36-year-old woman with a young son who is pursuing higher education. Six years ago, she decided to open her grocery store in her own home. Alongside her business she also provides food to construction workers that are around her area. It is in this way that Erlinda generates her own income to be able to cover her household costs and to be able to support her son in his studies.  Erlinda's greatest desire is to purchase a lot in the city to improve her quality of life.  

The loan will be invested in the purchase of grocery goods for her store. She is very content to have received the support of Kiva investors.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny es una mujer de 44 años de edad, Casada, tiene 2 hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, solidaria, optimista, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘san Juan Macias’ una área céntrica que hospeda a edificios comerciales, públicos, universidades, escuelas y todo tipo de negocios, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Jenny es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como transportista, y con sus hijos que son independientes, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de las marcas; esika, avon, cyzone y otros que realiza en un puesto fijo de venta y también de forma ambulante a clientes constantes. Los productos más vendidos son; lápiz labial, perfumes, cremas anti edad, mascara para pestañas, aretes, tratamientos faciales, etc. “inicie mi negocio como una forma de independizarme, fui ofreciendo los productos casa por casa y logré conseguir una cartera de clientes continuos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es independiente y trabaja como su salud se lo permite, la desventaja es la competencia en constante crecimiento. Su sueño es abrir una empresa distribuidora de cosméticos y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un stock de cosméticos de temporada por mayor, para mejorar sus ingresos y consolidar su negocio. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jenny solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para consolidar su negocio y con los beneficios abrir una empresa distribuidora.
texts.en:
Jenny is a married woman, age 44. She has two independent children and a business selling cosmetics.
She is enterprising, independent, supportive, optimistic, kind, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the San Juan Macias zone, a central area with commercial, public, and university buildings as well as schools and all kinds of businesses. The climate is warm and subtropical with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius. 
Jenny is olive-skinned with brown eyes and long chestnut hair which she wears in a ponytail. She is short and robust. Her mother tongue is Guaraní. She speaks it with her family; she also speaks Spanish due to the general culture and in her business. She shares her life with her husband, who works in transportation, and her independent children. They live in their own home made of brick and cement with a laminate roof. They have drinking water, electricity, and plumbing. 
Jenny sells brand-name cosmetics:Esika, Avon, Cyzone, and others. She has a fixed sales location but also sells door-to-door to fixed clients. Her most popular products are lipstick, perfume, anti-aging creams, mascara, earrings, and facial treatments. "I started my business as a way to become independent. I was offering products door-to-door and was able to build up a clientele", she says. Her advantage is being independent. She works as her health allows. Her challenge is the competition, which is constantly growing. Her dream is to open a cosmetics distributor, and she wants to invest in her business by buying a stock of seasonal cosmetics wholesale to improve her income and solidify her business. This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the 8 years she has had this business.
Jenny is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of cosmetics to solidify her business and use her earnings to open a distributor.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics wholesale in order to open a distributor.

loans.name: Billy Joan

texts.es:
Billy tiene 26 años, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa de sus padres en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su propia mototaxi, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para realizar arreglos y reparaciones en su vehiculo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto el espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que va a incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Billy, age 26, is in a common-law marriage.  He lives in his parents’ house in a community that devotes itself to commerce, agriculture, and livestock.  It is located in the Zaña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides transportation service in his own ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  He has experience in this business, and he has good personal and work references in his district.

He will use the loan to make some repairs to his vehicle, which is currently in bad condition.  With this he hopes to offer better service to his customers.  This will increase his level of income and will, therefore, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su propia mototaxi, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo va a utilizar en la compra de accesorios para su mototaxi así como realizar algunos arreglos que necesita su vehículo, con esto Juan espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que va a tener un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old, single, and lives in his parents house in a community that is dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and animal husbandry, which is located in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

He works providing transportation services in his own mototaxi. He has experience in this business and good personal and work references in his district. He is going to use the loan for the purchase of accessories for his mototaxi, as well as to make some necessary repairs to his vehicle. With this, Juan hopes to offer better service to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income level and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for his mototaxi, as well as to make some necessary repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johanna es una joven con 29 años de edad, divorciada y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente vive en unión libre. Es trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Cuando se separó de su esposo su negocio decreció debido a que tuvo que asumir los gastos del hogar. Una hija cursa la primaria y el otro es un niño de 10 meses. Ahora cuenta con una pareja que le ayuda en las necesidades básicas de su familia y por eso ella quiere invertir fuerte en su actividad, la cual le permitió salir adelante con su hija. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio ambulante de ropa y de ventas por catálogos. Durante el períódo de su embarazo y el post parto, estuvieron un poco bajas las ventas, debido a que tenia que cuidar a su bebé. Ahora su meta es reforzar su actividad productiva para aumentar sus ingresos y seguir apoyando la economía familiar, asi dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Gracias a su experiencia y al buen trato que le da a sus clientes le va bien. Su negocio ha sido financiado en varias ocasiones por la Fundación. Siempre ha mostrado excelente moral de pago. Ésta vez solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería, aumentar sus ventas y superarse.
texts.en:
Johanna is a young 29-year-old, divorced with two children. She currently has a partner. She is hard-working with a business vision. When she separated from her husband, her business struggled because she had to take on the household costs. Her daughter is in elementary school and her son is ten months old.
She now has a partner who helps her with the family's basic needs. She wants to invest strongly in her business. It will allow her to support her daughter. She has always sold clothing door-to-door and by catalogue. When she was pregnant and shortly after giving birth, she had low sales because she had to care for her baby. Now, her goal is to strengthen her business to increase her income and continue supporting her family. This way, she hopes to give her family a better quality of life. Thanks to her experience and good customer service, her business is going well. She has obtained financing several times from the Fundacion. She has always demonstrated excellent repayment practices. This time, she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise, increase her sales, and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes by catalog.

loans.name: Yonasan

texts.en:
Yonatan, 25, is married with one child aged one-and-a-half years old. Yonatan has ventured into buying and selling maize, rice, beans and other items in Hoima, Uganda as a way to supplement his income from his business of operating a drug shop. 

Yonatan hopes to expand his business to meet the demands of his customers and to fulfill a family dream of looking after his family and building a dream house. 

He will use this loan to buy more drugs to sell in his drug shop.

loans.use: to buy more medications to sell.

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: Regine est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Tosheka», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, dynamique, veuve, âgée de 62 ans, mère 4 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds  reçu de sa famille. Elle est vendeuse des braises au marché central de la ville depuis 17 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 15 sacs de braises. Elle  souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses  enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Regine is a trader and the president of the "Tosheka" loan group, client of the Hekima MFI. She is dynamic, widowed, 62 years old and mother of 4 children who are all studying. She started her business with funds received from her family. She has been selling charcoal in the central market in the city for 17 years. She is going to purchase 15 bags of charcoal. She wishes to increase her capital, school and feed her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for the support given to financially excluded entrepreneurs,

loans.use: To purchase 15 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан, 44 года, замужем, 2 детей. У Гулжан высшее образование, работает учителем в сельской школе. Она по характеру: спокойная, любезная и трудолюбивая. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжан, в хозяйстве имеется: 3 коровы, 27 овец и коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и коз. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Gulzhan, 44, is married and has two children. She has a university degree and works as a teacher at a a village school. She is quiet, amiable and hardworking. She makes her living from livestock breeding and land cultivation. Through her hard work, Gulzhan owns three cows and 27 sheep and goats. Hoping to expand her business, Gulzhan is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy a cow and more goats. The loan will help her to increase her herd and renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy a cow and goats in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Dovi est une femme mariée et est mère de trois enfants. Dovi habite dans le quartier d’Adamavo et vend des friperies et des chaussures dans son quartier. Dovi réalise un revenu grâce à son activité pour aider ses enfants. Dovi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des habits et des chaussures, Dovi demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Aged 39 years, Dovi is a married woman and mother of three children. Dovi lives in the Adamavo neighborhood and sells second-hand clothes and shoes there. Dovi earns money from this activity to help her children. She gets her supplies once per month at the market. So as to order clothes and shoes, Dovi is asking for this loan to reach her goals and earn a good profit margin.

loans.use: to buy 10 bundles of clothes and 20 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Katty Elizabeth

texts.es:
Manta es conocida en el Ecuador por tener uno de los mejores puertos marítimos, en  este lugar hay muchos restaurantes y diversos sitios de esparcimiento.
En este lugar vive la señora Katty,  tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2  hijos de 14 y 11 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer profesional.
Doña Katty con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa y sabanas. Trabaja todos los días de 08h00 a 17h00, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, a ella le encanta vender y esto lo viene realizando desde hace un año y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son sabanas para niños. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sabanas, ropa interior y ropa para niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 ciclos, le gusta las charlas educativas y la unión del grupo.
texts.en:
Manta is known in Ecuador for having one of the best seaports. There are many restaurants there and different places for entertainment. 

This is where Katty lives. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 14 and 11. They are in school and her husband is a professional driver. 

In order to have her own income, Katty sells clothing and sheets. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m and she sells door to door. She loves to sell and she has done this for a year. It has gone very well for her because she has a lot of customers. What she sells the most is sheets for children. 

She is going to use this loan to buy sheets, underwear and clothing for children. She has been in the credit group for 2 cycles. She likes the educational talks and the group's unity.

loans.use: to buy sheets, underwear and clothing for children.

loans.name: Virginia Antonio

texts.es:
Virginia, de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, debido a la mala situación económica no pudo continuar estudiando y porque eran 9 hermanos y su padre los abandonó; ahora, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica  a la agricultura, tienen 7 hijos, 4 de ellos ya están acompañados. 

Virginia, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y pipían, este oficio lo aprendió con sus padres y cuando se acompaño, continuo con ese mismo trabajo para ayudarle a su pareja en los gastos del hogar, sus cultivos están a 2 kilómetros de su casa y para llegar hasta ahí tienen que caminar, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno para sus hijos y luego a las 6:00 a.m. se va a dejarle la comida a su pareja y se queda ayudandole hasta las 11:00 a.m. porque después tiene que regresar para preparar el almuerzo.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar semilla, abono, veneno y preparar la tierra para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.  

Su sueños son, que sus últimos dos hijos se preparen academicamente, comprar un terreno y dejarles a cada uno donde vivan y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Virginia, age 44, was in school until second grade. Because of a bad economic situation, she was unable to continue in school because she had nine siblings and her father abandoned them. She is now married and her partner works in agriculture. They have seven children, four of whom are already in relationships.
Virginia plants corn and the pipian dish. She learned this work from her parents, and when she got married she continued with this work to help her husband with the household costs. Her land is located two kilometres from her home, and they must walk to get there. She gets up at 4 am to prepare breakfast for her children, and at 6 am she brings food to husband and stays to help him until 11 am; after this, she has to return to prepare lunch.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to prepare the land for sowing 14,000 square metres of corn.
Her dreams are for the rest of her children to get an education; to buy land; to leave each of her children somewhere to live; and to have a store.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to prepare the land for sowing 14,000 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es:
Claribel tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como pollos, patos, gallinas, entre otros, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de cerdos, cuyes, patos, gallinas para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Claribel is 45 and has a live-in partner. She lives in her own home with her two children in a rural zone of the Cayaltí district, a community dedicated to agriculture and livestock, located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.
Claribel raises and sells barnyard animals like chickens, hens, and ducks. She has had this business for ten years and runs her business from her home. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of hogs, ducks, guinea pigs and hens to increase her stock. Her goal is to expand her business and satisfy her clients' needs, in order to generate more income to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hogs, guinea pigs, ducks, and hens.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans qui vit dans le quartier d’Adamavo pour entreprendre son activité. Yawa vend du pain et des fruits dans son quartier  pour réaliser son bénéfice. Yawa s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Yawa demande ce crédit pour commander des pains, des oranges et des bananes afin de bien vendre et avoir plus de bénéfice. Yawa désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Yawa is a 32-year old married woman who lives in the Adamavo neighborhood where she carries out her business. Yawa sells bread and fruits in her neighbourhood in order to make a profit. She gets her supplies five times per month at the market. Yawa is asking for this loan so that she can order bread, oranges and bananas to make good sales and earn more profit. Yawa wants to earn money to support her husband with the family expenses and to ensure her children have a good education.

loans.use: to buy 11 breads, 20 oranges and 3 baskets of bananas

loans.name: Justina Anita

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Justina,  tiene 56  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es albañil y obrero. 
Doña Justina es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa (camisetas, jeans, ropa interior, etc.). Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja  todos los días de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 12 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, sandalias y ropa. Está  en el Grupo De Crédito 10 años y le gusta porque los requisitos para hacer los créditos son pocos y  fáciles de hacer. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular and frequently-visited beachside resort in Ecuador due to its beautiful and friendly beaches and for being the first deep water port both in Ecuador and South America. 

This is where Justina lives. She is 56 years old, is married and has 6 grown-up and independent children from this marriage. Her husband is a bricklayer and labourer. 

Justina is a housewife who makes a living selling all kinds of clothes (shirts, jeans, underwear etc) as well as Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and womens' accessories) to make her own income and help her husband with the household expenses. 

She works every day for between two and three house. She sells her products on a payment instalment system in which she receives the payments every eight days. She has been doing this job for 12 years and it's going really well. Her best-selling products are perfumes and cosmetics. 

She is requesting this loan to buy perfume, sandals and clothes. She has been a member of the Loan Group for 10 years and she likes it because there aren't many requirements to get the loans and they are simple to meet. 

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, sandals and clothes.

loans.name: Tania Dolores

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 42  años de edad y  está divorciada,  tiene tres hijos de 16, 8 y 5 años los mismos que estudian en la universidad y dos en la escuela. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Tania con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y al alquiler de sillas, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la tarde ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, por pedidos y cobra semanalmente, a ella le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace dos años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son blusas y camisetas para mujer.  El alquiler de sillar lo tiene por más de 12 años, estas actividades las realiza sola y este negocio lo inicio con capital propio.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace dos ciclo y le gusta la facilidad de los pagos y bajo interés.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, popular, and visited seaside resort town in Ecuador because of its beautiful, welcoming beaches. It was the first deep sea port in Ecuador and South America.

This is the place where Tania, age 42, lives.  She is divorced and has three children, ages 16, 8, and 5.  One child goes to the university, and two of them go to elementary school.  They live in their own house.

In order to have her own income, Tania sells all types of clothes and rents chairs.  She works every day, mostly in the afternoon.  These are the hours that are easiest for her to make her rounds.  She sells door to door and by orders.  She collects weekly.  She loves to sell, and she has been doing so for two years.  It has gone very well for her because she has a lot of customers.  What she sells the most are women’s blouses and t-shirts.  

She has had her business of renting chairs for over 12 years.  She conducts these business activities by herself, and she started the business with her own capital.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.  She has been in her communal bank for two cycles.  She likes the ease of the payments and the low interest.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Jasmina Vanessa

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Jasmina,  tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos de 16, 11 y  10 años los mismos que estudian en el colegio uno y en escuela dos. El cónyuge es maestro en fibra.
Doña Jasmina con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, también tiene un tanquero que entrega agua en diferentes  zonas de manta, trabaja de lunes a viernes por seis horas diarias, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, por pedidos y cobra semanalmente, a ella le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace ocho años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, ropa y ropa interior. Está en el grupo de crédito por 7 ciclos y le gusta el grupo de crédito por las chalas educativas y los seguros.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, popular and visited seaside town of Ecuador because of its beautiful and pleasing beaches, the first deepwater port of Ecuador and South America.

This is where Jasmina lives. She is 33 years old and in a common law marriage from which she has 3 children, aged 16, 11 and 10. One is in high school and two are in elementary school. Her spouse works with fiber. 

In order to have her own income, Jasmina sells all kinds of clothing. She also has a tank truck that delivers water to different area in Manta. She works Monday through Friday six hours a day. She sells door to door, to order and collects every week. She loves to sell and she has been doing it for eight years. It has gone very well for her and she has a lot of customers. 
 
She is going to use this loan to buy perfumes, jewelry, clothing and underwear. She has been in the credit group for 7 cycles and she likes the credit group for its educational talks and the insurance.

loans.use: to buy perfume, jewelry, clothing, and underwear.

loans.name: Jesaria

texts.en:
Jesaria, 20, is from Kananga, Leyte, in the Philippines. She is a single mother to her two-year-old daughter. 

She and her family have been engaged in selling motor parts and making hollow blocks for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy more tires to sell to increase her profits. 

Jesaria hopes that she can sustain her business and make possible expansions to increase the business's profitability. Her income will be for her child’s future education, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more tires to sell

loans.name: Prospero

texts.es:
Prospero tiene 55 años, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijo de 14 años, su cónyuge se dedica a labores de casa y su hijo estudia secundaria en colegio nacional de la zona. Prospero tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad conocida por sus famosas ruinas de Zaña, habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Propero se dedica a prestar servicio de alquiler de yuntas y cargas de panca seca desde hace más de 06 años aproximadamente. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de un toro pequeño, para criarlo para posterior alquiler del mismo, lo que le permitirá a unos meses mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Prospero is 55 and married. He lives in his own home with his wife and 14-year-old son. His wife does the house work and his child is in secondary school in the local national school. Prospero has good personal and work references. His family is united. He lives in a community known for the famous Zaña ruins, inhabited by kind and respectful people who work in commerce, agriculture, and livestock. The community is located in the Zaña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.
Prospero has had a business renting out teams of livestock and carrying loads of dried maize leaf for about six years. He needs a loan to invest in the purchase of a small bull to raise and later rent out. This will allow him to improve his income some months from now, and to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a small bull to raise and rent out.

loans.name: Nyambere Group

texts.fr:
Suavis fait partie du groupe  Nyambere et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à Paul, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 3 à 5 ans.
 
Elle fait le commerce de  pomme de terre  depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de pomme de terre à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Suavis belongs to the Nyambere group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and married to Paul, a trader. Together they have two children aged from 3 to 5 years. She has been selling potatoes for 6 years. She is on her sixth loan with Turame. With the Kiva credit she will obtain, she will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of potatoes to resell in order to earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food items for sale

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 41-year-old single woman with three children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She works selling second-hand clothing and also earns additional income from rentals. Annet’s business challenges include limited capital and market competition. 

Annet is requesting a loan to buy building materials such as cement and sand and to pay for labor to improve her family’s house. She has a dream of completing her home as a special package for her children.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay for labor

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул, 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Нургул среднее образование, уже 19 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. На участке мерою 1,78 Га она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход Нургул составляет всего 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нургул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nurgul, 40, is married and has three children. She has a high school diploma. She has been cultivating land for 19 years and now owns four cows, ten sheep and two horses. She grows barley on her 1.78 ha plot of land. Her monthly income is only 15,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Nurgul is requesting a loan of 110,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to expand her business. The loan will help her to buy two more cows and increase her herd. She plans to invest the profit in the purchase of more livestock.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 61 years old and has five grown dependents. She lives in the town of Alburquerque, Bohol. For the past year, Lina has been raising hogs. She has no adequate funds to sustain her business.

Lina is requesting a loan to buy piglets and feed. Her loan will help her to expand her business and she will be able to raise and sell more hogs in the coming months. Lina’s income will improve and she will be able to set aside some savings for emergency use. In the future, she hopes to properly manage her business and have it become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 40 years old and has eight children. She is from the town of Kananga in Leyte. For the past year, she has been raising hogs and earns 5,000 PHP each month.

Angelina is requesting a loan to buy feed and supplements to fatten her hogs. Her loan will make her hogs healthy and easy to market in four months time. Angelina hopes that in the near future she will be able to engage in other business opportunities to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of different types of beer to sell to customers

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 52 years old and is married to David. She supports a family with five members. For the past 12 years, Jackline has been operating a retail business and she earns a monthly income of 9,500 KES. 

Jackline is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy additional stock of basins, buckets, jugs and other home products. She will use her profit to repay her loan and stabilize her business. Jackline’s hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to buy basins, buckets, jugs, and other home products

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Narcisa Indelira

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Narcisa, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El cónyuge es comerciante de mariscos.
Doña Narcisa con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, aunque en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, su hija trabaja también en el taller.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Este es su primer crédito con la fundación. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde también pueda vender sus obras.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular and visited seaside town of Ecuador because of its beautiful and pleasing beaches. It is the first deepwater port of Ecuador and South America.  

This is where Narcisa lives. She is 50 years old and she is in a common law marriage from which she has three grown children who are on their own. Her spouse is a seafood merchant. 

In order to obtain her own income and taking advantage of her knowledge in cutting and sewing Narcisa opened a small sewing shop in her house. She makes all kinds of clothing for women, men and children. She works based on orders from individuals, although during the season she makes school uniforms for institutions, primary schools and high schools in her community.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m., and sometimes later when she has orders to deliver. Her daughter also works in the shop. 

She is going to use this new loan to buy fabrics and other sewing materials. This is her first loan with the foundation. Her dream is to have a bigger shop and a store in the center of town where she can sell her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Adjo est une femme mariée qui vit avec quatre enfants à Adakpamé Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Adjo vend des pagnes en se déplaçant dans le quartier. Adjo réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des pièces de pagne, Adjo demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Adjo is a 37-year old, married woman who lives with four children in Adakpame. To take care of them, Adjo sells pagne cloth around the neighborhood.  Adjo earns a profit from this business and she buys her inventory four times per month at the market. Adjo is asking for this loan to pay for an order of cloth and to have a profit margin that will help her better contribute to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 8 pieces of "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Kisarawe One Group

texts.en:
Nyasinde, who is in her late fifties, is a widow with six kids; all of them have their own families and are independent. She has been running a retail shop for six years now and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Nyasinde's twelfth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing the shop inventory. Now her business is really big and serves many customers. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to increase her shop inventory and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Yunes

texts.en:
Yunes, 56 years old, is married to Samwuel and supports a family of five members.

She has been a small-scale farmer for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,500.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings for farming.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and stabilize her farming. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for farming.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 35 years old, a hard-working  married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He does metal fabrication, making doors and windows. He has been in business since 2012 and it has helped him to provide his family with all the basic needs of life. He has a dream of being the best supplier of quality windows and doors in the area. However, his business is faced with the challenge of power shut-downs that make him fail to deliver his services on time. 

Augustine is requesting a loan to buy welding materials for making doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy welding materials for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Kako School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Micahel. He is the Deputy Head Teacher of Kako Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kako in Masaka with 600 students.

Kako School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kako School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Micahel ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Joenalyn

texts.en:
Joenalyn, 34, is  a married woman who engages in a fish-vending business. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs. She has three dependents ages 16-6 years old. 

She is asking for a loan  to buy more stock of fish and purchase piglets and feed.  These resources will enhance the quality of hogs Joenalyn is about to raise. She could also sells different varieties of fish, thus enabling her to improve her income.
 
Joenalyn is grateful for the loan she accesses, that would really be an instrument that would help expand both her businesses for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 53 years old. She is a resident of Kananga, Leyte. She is married, and her husband is a driver. They have six children together. Two of the children are still dependents, ages 10 and 12.

Victoria has been raising hogs for five years. She usually has a profit of 12,000 PHP per month from this business. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed, and supplements, and to pay for barn repair.

In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and supplements, and to pay for barn repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastics and other utensils for sale in the market

loans.name: Bekbol

texts.ru: Бекбол, 58 лет, женат, есть 6 детей. У него средне-специальное образование, очень ответственный, честный и целеустремленный. Занимается сельским хозяйством, в качестве дополнительного дохода. Стартовав много лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Бекбола, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется дойная корова и бычок, на ежедневной основе продает молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бекбол обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения удоя молока. Доходы от кредита позволят Бекболу развить бизнес и отремонтировать сараи.
texts.en: Bekbol, 58, is married and has six children. He has vocational secondary education and is very responsible, honest and goal-oriented. His additional source of income is agriculture. He started out many years ago. Through his hard work, Bekbol now owns a dairy cow and a bull-calf. He sells milk on a daily basis. He has a monthly income of up to 8,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Bekbol is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy a dairy cow and increase the volume of organic milk sales. Bekbol will invest the profit in expanding his business and renovating the barns.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a hair-cutting machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk and increase his income.

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу, 26 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Образование у нее высшее, работает на госслужбе. В 2009 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота, первую нетель помогли купить родители. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, лошадь, 10 овец. Также на арендованном земельном участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает ячмень для реализации. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Совокупный среднемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Айсулуу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита позволят ей и дальше развивать бизнес.
texts.en: Aisuluu, 26, is married and has two children. She has a university degree and is a civil servant. In 2009 she started breeding livestock. Her parents helped her with the first purchase. Today Aisuluu owns two cows, a horse and ten sheep. She grows barley for sale on her 1.0 ha rented plot of land and sells milk on a daily basis. Her total monthly income is about 15,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Aisuluu is requesting a loan of 150,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy three cows. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Zhainagul

texts.ru: Жайнагул, 26 лет, замужем, есть шестимесячная дочь. Жайнагул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав свою деятельность в 2013 году, на сегодня в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 4 лошади, 10 овец. Также на земельном участке, мерою 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,15 Га собственной земли она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ежедневно Жайнагул продает молоко. Она полна сил и энергии развивать свой бизнес. Сегодня ежемесячная прибыль Жайнагул составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Жайнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhainagul, 26, is married and has a six-month-old daughter. Her family’s primary sources of income are livestock breeding and land cultivation. Having started out in 2013, she now owns four cows, four horses and ten sheep. She grows barley for sale on 1.0 ha of rented and 1.15 ha of her own land and sells milk on a daily basis. She is full of energy and ready to expand her business. Today her monthly income is 25,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Zhainagul is requesting a loan of 150,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy steer calves for fattening and resale. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Eri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Eri. Eri lives in Kudus, located east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java. It is a nine hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Eri is happily married. Together with his wife, they have one cute daughter. 

Eri has been a part of Ruma for a year after hearing from a Ruma sales executive who came to his house. Right now, Eri is becoming an agent for Ruma and will sell mobile airtime credits. He decided to join Ruma because he is interested in Ruma’s system. Moreover, his community sees him as a trustworthy mobile provider. The sales executive will be coming to Eri's house to collect money.

As the business grows, Eri is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits in his communities. Your loan will be very useful to help Eri improve his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Eri is sitting in front of his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Manos Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Manos Emprendedoras se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, con la unión de amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, son 22 mujeres muy trabajadoras que ayudan a sus familias por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien al igual que las otras integrantes está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas que vende de manera ambulante, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia. Quiere tener algún día una tienda muy grande donde poder ofrecer más variedad para sus clientes, y para poder cumplir con sus pedidos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, como ser camisas, jeans, remeras, pantalones y otros, y con ello poder seguir luchando por su familia y por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group called Manos Emprendedoras [Enterprising Hands] was founded in the city of Encarnación when a group of friends and neighbors from that city joined together. The group is made up of 22 hard-working women who help their families through their efforts and hard work. 

Maria is one of the members, and she is part of the elimination of poverty program as are the others. She sells clothing going door-to-door, and this provides financial resources to help her family. One day she hopes to have a very large store where she can offer a greater variety to her customers and be able to fulfill their orders. 

She is asking for this loan so she can buy clothing to sell such as shirts, jeans, t-shirts, pants, and other items, so she can continue her fight against poverty on behalf of her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, t-shirts, pants, and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Marquetalia Group

texts.es:
Marquetalia está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene la esperanza de poder mejorar y crecer cada día para ayudar a sus familias. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona.
Ella se dedica al humilde trabajo de la venta de remedios naturales, y por medio de su sacrificado esfuerzo tiene los medios y los ingresos necesarios para poder dar a su familia una vida digna. Es una persona muy dedicada y luchadora y quiere poder seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales varios para la venta, y con ello poder seguir luchando por el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
The group "Marquetalia" is in their first loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. This is a new group that has hopes of being able to improve and grow each day to help their families. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight Program where one of the members is Ramona.

She works in the humble job of selling natural remedies and through her sacrifice and effort has the means and income necessary to provide her family with a dignifies life. She is a very dedicated person and a fighter who wants to continue to grow. She is requesting this loan to buy natural remedies to sell and then she can continue to struggle for the good of her family.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to re-sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, 24, is married with two children, one who goes to school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop, selling general merchandise, and does farming for additional income. 

Vincent is requesting a loan to buy maize flour, ground nuts, charcoal, salt and bananas to sell and meet customer demand. 

Educating his children is his dream, however much he is faced with the challenge of limited capital.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, ground nuts, charcoal, salt and bananas for selling.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly, 41, is married with six children. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 23 years. With her children still in school, Shirly works very hard to provide for them.

Shirly has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, personal care products and other items to sell.

She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, personal care products and other items to sell.

loans.name: Buzara

texts.ru: Бузара, 54 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Вся семья с радостью помогает Бузаре в ведении ее бизнеса. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Бузара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения ее будущих доходов. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Buzara, 54, is a widow and has three children. She earns a living from agriculture. She has two cows. Buzara's family happily helps her with her business. Her monthly income is about 11,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) but this amount of money is not enough for a dignified life. Buzara is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy cows and increase her income. She plans to invest the profit in more livestock and to save money for home renovation.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her income

loans.name: Caacupe Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Caacupe Poty está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé. Las 21 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. Una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Maria, tiene una despensa muy bien surtida que tiene de todo, y cumple con eso con los pedidos de sus clientes. Es una mujer que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, bebidas, lácteos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, esforzándose por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group called Caacupe Poty is in its third cycle with the women's committee program. It is located in the city of Caacupé. The 21 members of the committee put forth a great deal of effort in order to get ahead together with their families.

Maria is a member who stands out. She has a store that is well-supplied and has everything and is always able to satisfy her customers' orders. She is a woman who gives everything of herself  to improve her living conditions and help her family. She is asking for this loan so she can buy vegetables, fruits, drinks, dairy products, etc. so she can continue selling her products, pushing herself to do better each day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 35-year-old divorced woman living with her mother. In 2010, Hiyam started her own business by opening a small room in her house to sell and make faux bijoux and accessories. She provides high quality products and sells them using her special selling methods. 

Hiyam is well known in her region for having special talents in her business, in addition to caring for her customers. Today, Hiyam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to increase her business merchandise in order to meet the needs of her clients and increase her income. Hiyam is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to expand.

loans.use: to increase her jewelry business merchandise.

loans.name: Stella Maris S School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Madinah. She is the head teacher at Stella Maris Secondary School, a mixed school with 230 students in the urban area of Nyendo in Masaka. 

Stella Maris Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not have consistent access to clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. 

This loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. The school will repay its loan from school fees, which are collected each term.
