Madinah ultimately hopes that access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students who come to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Duvvan Felipe

texts.es:
Duwan es un joven de 18 años de edad, hijo de campesinos, resideente de una zona rural, lo hace diferente de muchas personas su forma de pensar, su deseo de superación personal y hacer algo diferente de lo que su familia está acostumbra hacer, el busca seguir sus propios caminos, por ello trabaja para pagar sus estudios, está juntando capital para irse a Medellín a presentarse a alguna universidad.

Duwan se dedica a la venta de productos  de uso personal de una marca extranjera, son productos para el cuidado de la salud, para el cuidado del cuerpo, como pastillas, bebidas, lociones, jarabes entre otros.

Es muy trabajador recorre a pie las veredas y tiene como principal reto cambiar la mentalidad de las personas y mostrarles que el productos si puede ser muy beneficioso.

Duwan es muy joven y necesita de tu apoyo para la compra de estos productos, buscando lucrarse para cumplir su sueño de estudiar en Medellín y principalmente cambiar los hábitos de alimentación de las personas que le compra.
texts.en:
Duwan is a young man of 18. He lives in a rural area and is the son of farmers. He's different to other people because of his way of thinking and his desire for self-improvement and to do something different with his life rather than what his family are used to doing. He's working to pay for his own education so that he can follow his own path in life. He's getting the money together to go to Medellin to attend to one of the city's universities. 

Duwan makes a living selling a foreign brand of personal hygiene products. They are health and body products such as pills, drinks, lotions and soaps etc. 

He is very hardworking and he gets around the streets on foot. His main challenge is changing peoples' mentality and showing them that the products can be very beneficial. 

Duwan is very young and needs your help to buy these products so he can make his own money to make his dream of studying in Medellin come true, as well as his dream of changing the eating habits of the people who buy his products.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products. They are health and the body products such as pills, drinks, lotions and soaps etc.

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан, 49 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Рыскан - среднее образование, работает в школе, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 29 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Рыскан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 15 овец, 4 лошади. На 1,20 Га собственной земли выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 лошадей. Доходы от кредита Рыскан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на постройку сараев.
texts.en: Ryskan, 49, is married and has three children. She has a high school diploma and works for a local school. Her family’s primary sources of income are livestock breeding and agriculture. She started out 29 years ago. Through her hard work, Ryskan owns two cows, fifteen sheep and four horses. She grows barley on her 1.20 ha plot of land. Ryskan is requesting a loan of 150,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy two horses. She plans to invest the profit in more livestock and save money for building sheds.

loans.use: to buy two horses in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
El Comité Sol y Luna es un grupo nuevo, son 17 mujeres, activas, trabajadoras y muy sacrificadas que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de su unión.
Leticia es una vendedora muy buena, se dedica a la venta de perfumes varios, tiene todo tipo de productos, y poco a poco está luchando por mejorar. Leticia lucha por sus seres queridos para poder darles una vida sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de perfumes varios para poder seguir con sus ventas, y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en: The committee "Sol y Luna" is a new group with 17 active, hard-working and very determined women who wants to help their families from this grouping. Leticia is a very good salesperson. She works selling a variety of perfumes. She has all kinds of products and little by little is striving to improve. Leticia is fighting for her loved ones to be able to provide them a life without hardships. She is requesting this loan to buy various perfumes to be able to continue with her sales and fill requests from her clients. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving to improve.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, ya que todas ellas son eso mismo, mujeres muy trabajadoras que luchan y quieren capacitarse para mejorar, además están trabajando dentro de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Cristina forma parte de este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vende frutas y verduras, tiene todo tipo de productos frescos y de estación, es una muy buena vendedora y le esta yendo muy bien. Es muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza y quiere mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas para poder venderlas y así poder cumplir con sus clientes y con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
This group has adopted the name "Working Women" because all of the members are this first and foremost. They are very hard-working women who are aggressively attempting to prepare themselves to improve. In addition, they are working within a program for the elimination of poverty.

Cristina, a member of this group, is a very hard-working woman who sells fruits and vegetables. She offers all types of fresh and seasonal products. 

Cristina is a good vendor and things are presently going very well for her. She works hard and competes vigorously to get ahead and improve her life. 

Cristina is requesting this loan to purchase additional fresh fruits and vegetables to sell and, thus, to be able to satisfy her customers' requests.

loans.use: purchase fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zhyrgalbek

texts.ru: Жыргалбек, 50 лет, женат, 6 детей. Образование высшее, работает в доме культуры. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи с 1992 года занимается животноводством. Начатый с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS) бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Жыргалбека, на сегодня насчитывает 4 коровы, 20 овец и лошадь и приносит доход около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи скота и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыргалбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма. На средства полученные от реализации скота, он планирует построить еще сараи.
texts.en: Zhyrgalbek, 50, is married and has six children. He has a university degree and works at a cultural center. Since 1992 livestock breeding has been his family’s primary source of income. Having started out with a sum of 5,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS), through his hard work and persistence Zhyrgalbek now owns four cows, twenty sheep and a horse. He makes about 15,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) a month by selling livestock and dairy products. Zhyrgalbek is requesting a loan of 150,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy steers for fattening and resale. He plans to invest the profit in building more barns and sheds.

loans.use: to buy some steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзада, 34 года, замужем. Она пунктуальна, корректна и ответственна. Занимается торговлей овощами на рынке. Ежемесячный доход около 20,000 сом (KGS). Айзада обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения овощей для реализации.   В будущем Айзада собирается увеличить свой бизнес и накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Aizada, 34, is married. She is punctual, tactful and responsible. She earns a living by selling vegetables at a local market. Her monthly income is about 20,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Aizada is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy vegetables for resale. In the future Aizada plans to expand her business and save money to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Dwi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's new agents, Dwi. Dwi lives in Magelang, Central Java, which is a city located about an hour and a half from Jakarta by plane. She lives with her husband and her 4-year-old child. 

Dwi owns a stall where she sells small snacks and drinks, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services for her community. Dwi is known by her neighbors as a cheerful and kind woman, which is why it’s really easy for her to attract customers. As a woman, she began to realize that she needed to help her husband improve their life by increasing their income. Therefore, almost a year ago, she decided to join Ruma and provide the services that allow her customers to buy mobile phone credits and pay their bills.

As the business grows, Dwi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Dwi improve her business, as well as to her community who needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Dwi is smiling and standing. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 46 years old, and supports a family of five members. She has been a small scale farmer for the last 10 years earning a monthly income of 7,500 KES. 

Joyce applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to use to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting. She plans to use gained profits to repay the loan and stabilize her farming. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 3º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, son 22 mujeres que se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa manera ir mejorando.
Maria es la presidenta de este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora que además de ser integrante de este grupo es la presidenta que está mejorando por medio de su esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, condimentos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group called "San Cayetano" is in their 3rd loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. There are 22 women who got together to be able to help each other and in this way improve.

Maria is the president of the group. She is a hard-working woman who besides being a member of this group as the president is improving by way of her efforts. She works selling food products that she makes herself and sells itinerantly. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her food such as vegetables, beef, chicken, condiments and others. In this way she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beef, chicken, condiments and others.

loans.name: Kulushkan

texts.ru: Кулушкан, 59 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже 10 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря накопленной прибыли смогла открыть магазин возле дома. Упорный труд Кулушкан приносит около 80,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Однако этих средств катастрофически не хватает на содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулушкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Кулушкан улучшить материальное положение и условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Kulushkan, 59, is a widow and has three children. She has vocational secondary education. Her family’s primary source of income over the last ten years has been agriculture. She saved the profits in order to open a shop next to her house. Through her hard work, Kulushkan earns about 80,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) a month. However, this money does not allow the family to make ends meet. Kulushkan is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy livestock. The profit will improve her family’s income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mistica está en su ciclo número 3  del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Se ha hecho el semáforo de eliminación de pobreza, donde una señora se encontraba por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema pero ella pone todo de si para poder mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Victoria, ella tiene una despensa, que pudo montar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que poco a poco se ha abierto camino. Quiere poder seguir mejorando cada día, es por ello que participa muy activamente de las distintas capacitaciones.
 Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas, verduras, frutas, lácteos, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called "Rosa Mistica" is in their 3rd loan cycle of the Enterprising Women's Committee where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They have participated in the Poverty Stoplight survey where one woman is under the poverty line, that is to say extreme poverty but she puts all her effort into improving.

Victoria is one of the members. She has a store that she managed to open with much effort and determination. She is a hard-working person who little by little is finding her way. She wants to continue improving each day so she is participating very actively in the different training workshops.

She is requesting this loan to buy drinks, vegetables, fruit, dairy products, bread and others. In this way she can continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her living conditions

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, fruit, dairy products, bread and others.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан, 62 года, вдова. У нее средне-специальное образование, она 30 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Уулкан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется корова и 2 лошади. На 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает ячмень.  Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и доходов семьи.
texts.en: Uulkan is a 62-year-old widow. She has vocational secondary education. Her family’s primary sources of income over the last thirty years have been livestock breeding and land cultivation. She started out with a sum of 3,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Through her hard work, Uulkan owns a cow and two horses. She grows barley on her 1-ha plot of land.  She has a monthly income of approximately 8,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Uulkan is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy a cow. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and improving her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase her income

loans.name: Renacer 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer 2 tiene 21 integrantes, todas ellas son mujeres muy emprendedoras y quieren salir adelante. Ellas además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blasida.
Ella vende prendas variadas, y tiene todo tipo y variedad, comenta que es el sostén de su familia y que los medios que tiene es para dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no tuvo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, polleras, blusas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The group called “Renacer 2” has 21 members. All of them are very enterprising women who want to go forward. The women are also in a program aimed to eliminate poverty. One of the members is Mrs. Blasida. 

She sells clothing, and she has all types and varieties. She says that the business sustains her family and that the resources she has is to give her loved ones everything that she didn’t have.

She asks for this loan to be able to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, and other things. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking woman with two adult children from Kananga, Leyte. She has been raising hogs to earn a living so that she and her husband will not rely on their children for their needs. 

Nenita is requesting a loan for additional capital to buy piglets, feed and supplements. She also plans to use some amount to renovate her barn. Nenita wishes to make her business a success. She would like to improve her business so that she can make the most out of her profit. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger barn with more pigs in it in order to earn a larger income.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, supplements and also to renovate her barn.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 26 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Динары высшее образование, работает в парикмахерской. Она с 2005 года занимается животноводством. В настоящее время у нее есть 3 коровы и 25 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Динары составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Она является лидером группы "Ийгилик-3", всего в группе 3 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Это поможет развить бизнес и накопить на обучение и воспитание детей.
texts.en: Dinara, 26, is married and has two children. She has a university degree and works in a hairdressing salon. She has been breeding livestock since 2005. She now owns three cows and twenty-five sheep. Her monthly profit is 15,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Dinara is the leader of the Iygilik-3 group, which consists of three members. Hoping to expand her business, Dinara is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy additional livestock for breeding. This will help Dinara to expand her business and save money for the education and upbringing of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kuña Guapa  de la ciudad de Itá  está en su ciclo número 9, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer su situación de vida y poco a poco ir mejorándola por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sandra quien hace y vende comidas, ella es muy buena en lo que hace, y hoy ya tiene muchos clientes. Comenta que poco a poco se ha hecho conocida y está creciendo todo por su esfuerzo y su sacrificio.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de verduras, carne, pollo, hortalizas y otros insumos para hacer comidas para poder vender. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de mejorar y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group is called “Kuña Guapa,” from the city of Itá. The group is in its ninth loan cycle. They are also in a program to eliminate poverty. The program allows them to understand their situation, and little by little, they continue to improve it through their work.

One of the members is Mrs. Sandra, who makes and sells food. She is very good at what she does, and she already has many clients. She says that little by little she has become well-known, and she is growing through her effort and sacrifice.

She asks for this loan to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, and other supplies to make the food she sells. 

She is thankful for this opportunity she receives to improve and help her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 42-year-old married woman living with her husband and children. In 2007, she opened a small shop where she sells gadgets, makeup, perfumes, and accessories. She uses her special selling skills and provides high quality products. She is well known in her region for offering unique objects, in addition to her friendly and adorable personality. 

Today, Rania is asking for a second loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to increase her inventory and to renovate her shop. She would like to meet the needs of her clients and improve her business. In the future she is planning to expand her work to other areas.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and to renovate her shop.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El comité  de Jovenes San Vicente está en su  1º ciclo, son Jóvenes que tienen ganas y deseos de mejorar la situación de vida tanto en el ámbito económico y bienestar de ellos
Uno de los integrantes es la Nilda ella  se mantiene con una actitud  emprendedora de seguir de manera constante con su labor, se dedica a vender lencerías y pide este préstamo para la compra de lencerías para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The young people in the “San Vicente” group are in their first loan cycle. They are young people who have the attitude and desire to improve their lives as much in their financial situation as in their wellbeing.

One of the members is Nilda. She has an enterprising attitude to continue with her work. She is dedicated to selling lingerie, and she asks for this loan to buy lingerie, so that she can continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive en la ciudad de San Ignacio, tiene un hijo por quien ella está luchando para darle todo lo que ella no pudo tener. 
Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida para ser ejemplo de su hijo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the city of San Ignacio. She has a son, for whom she is fighting to give him everything that she didn’t have.

She is studying nursing. She is putting everything she has to be able to grow and become someone in life to be an example for her son. 

She asks for this loan to be able to pay her school fees. With this, she will be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería eléctrica, por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino e ir mejorando por medio de sus conocimientos.
Está poniendo todo de sí para poder ser un profesional útil y servir a la sociedad.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir estudiando. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus sueños.
texts.en:
Angel is from the city of San Ignacio. He is studying electrical engineering. Through this field, he wants to open a path for himself to improve his life with his knowledge.

He is putting everything he has to be able to become a useful professional and to serve society. 

He is thankful for the opportunity that he receives to be able to continue studying. 

He asks for this loan to pay his school fees. With this, he will be able to continue with his dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of vegetables and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of plastics and mugs for selling in the market.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es de la ciudad de Encarnación, comenta que estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, que es algo muy sacrificado, y está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar.
Alberto está en su quinto año de la carrera de ingeniería agrónoma, es una persona muy emprendedora y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de su tesis, y así cubrir con ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Alberto is from the city of Encarnación. He says that he studies and works at the same time, which is very demanding. He is putting everything he has to be able to improve.

Alberta is in his fifth year of studying agricultural engineering. He is a very enterprising and determined person.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay for his thesis expenses. Thus, he will cover the cost for this expense.

loans.use: to pay for his expenses for his thesis.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es de la ciudad de Encarnación, esta estudiando la carrera de Derecho, es una mujer muy luchadora que esta poniendo todo de si para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Comenta que con su préstamo anterior lo que pudo hacer es pagar las cuotas de su carrera lo que le fue muy útil.
Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios y así estar mas cerca de sus metas.
texts.en:
Marlene is from the city of Encarnación. She is studying law. She is a determined woman who is putting everything she has into being able to improve her conditions of life. She says that with her previous loan, she was able to pay her university fees, which was very useful.

She asks for a new loan to be able to again pay her university fees. With this, she will be able to continue with her studies and, thus, be closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Estelbina

texts.es:
Estelbina  es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería porque tiene como aspiración ayudar y ser útil en su comunidad.
Ella quiere ser alguien en la vida, y es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder ser una profesional útil para los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
Estelbina is studying nursing because she has the goal of helping and being useful in her community.

She wants to become someone in life, and it is because of this that she puts everything she has into become a useful professional for others.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay her university fees and to continue with her studies. She is thankful for this opportunity she receives to be able to improve.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo es de la Ciudad de Encarnación,  se desempeña como mecánico en un taller de vehículos, además que trabaja estudia la carrera de ingeniería en informática.
Su aspiración es seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos profesionales  y de esa forma poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para el cubrir el gasto de sus útiles de la universidad, y con ello poder seguir con sus anhelos.
texts.en:
Aldo is from the city of Encarnación. He works as a mechanic in an automobile workshop. In addition to studying, he is studying computer engineering.

His goal is to continue enriching his professional knowledge. In this way, he will be able to improve his life and that of his family.

He asks for this loan to cover the costs of his university supplies. With this, he will be able to continue with his goals.

loans.use: to cover the costs of his university supplies.

loans.name: Carolina Libieht

texts.es:
Carolina es una joven emprendedora y perseverante, desde hace algunos años inició con la venta de fritanga en su casa, pero el deseo de superación la llevó a vender nacatamales, hasta que con ayuda las ganancias pudo iniciar una pulpería,  que con el tiempo ha ampliado, convertirla en un negocio próspero. 

Por ello, solicita un crédito comprar granos básicos, golosinas, papel higiénico, perfumes, jugos, salsa de tomate, pimientos, etc. Lo cual le ayudará para ofrecer mayor variedad e incrementar las ganancias. Así podrá ampliar su pulpería y paulatinamente se convertirá en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Carolina is a determined young entrepreneur. She began selling fried foods in her home a number of years ago, but her wish for self-improvement led her to sell nacatamales, traditional Nicaraguan corn-based dishes wrapped in plantain leaves and steamed. With her earnings, she was then able to set up a grocery store, which she has expanded over time to turn it into a prosperous business.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, sweets, toilet paper, perfume, juices, tomato sauce, peppers, etc. This will allow her to offer greater variety and boost her profits. As a result, she will be able to expand her grocery store and, gradually, she will become a distributor.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, toilet paper, perfume, juices, tomato sauce, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es estudiante de la Carrera Técnico en Enfermería, está cursando el Tercer Año, su meta es culminar sus estudios, trabajar y ayudar a las personas que requieran de sus servicios, ser una profesional y también ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Maria is in her third year of studying nursing. Her goal is to complete her studies, and to work and help people who need her services. She also wants to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given to be successful in life.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto es el mayor de sus hermanos, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Civil, se desempeña como obrero, y está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar cada día.
Él quiere ser una persona que sea útil a la sociedad y que se vaya abriendo camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar con sus cuotas y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Edilberto is the eldest of his siblings. He is studying for a degree in civil engineering. He also works as a laborer, and is devoting all his efforts to improving himself each day.

He wants to be a person who is useful to society and who is moving forward in life.

He is requesting this loan so that he can pay for his fees and continue attending school.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina lives in Kananga, Leyte, with her family. She is 49 years old. She has been engaged in hog raising and running a sari-sari (general) store for 19 years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy stock for her store, such as rice, canned goods, and noodles, and piglets for her barn. This will allow her to make her business more profitable because she will be able to refill her shelves in a timely way. 

In the future Cristina hope to sustain her business and buy more merchandise that she does not currently carry.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store, such as rice, canned goods, and noodles, and piglets for her barn

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive en la ciudad de Pilar, está estudiando la carrera de auditoria y contabilidad, y por medio de su profesión quiere abrirse camino.
Ella es una mujer que está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar e ir creciendo poco a poco. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, y con ello poder seguir con sus metas
texts.en:
Maria lives in the city of Pilar, and is studying a degree in auditing and accounting. She wants to use her profession to open doors. Maria is putting her all into improving and growing little by little. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given to continue improving every day.

She is requesting this loan to pay for her university graduation fees, so that she can continue to strive for her goals.

loans.use: to pay for her university graduation fees.

loans.name: Atyrbubu

texts.ru: Атырбубу, 57 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, работала библиотекарем, с 1998 года занимается полеводством. В настоящее время у Атырбубу есть 1,50 Га земли, где выращивает фасоль и картофель для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Атырбубу составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). Она является участником группы "Ийгилик-3", всего в группе 3 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атырбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на подготовку земли к полевым работам и выращиванию органических овощей. Доходы от бизнеса помогут развить бизнес.
texts.en: Atyrbubu, 57, is a widow and has three children. She has a university degree and worked as a librarian in the past. Since 1998 she has been cultivating land. She currently owns 1.50 ha of land where she grows haricot and potatoes for sale. Her total monthly income is 16,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Atyrbubu is a member of the Iygilik-3 group, which consists of three borrowers. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to prepare her land for cultivation and growing organic vegetables. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers for land cultivation and growing organic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy university supplies.

loans.name: Meylin Patricia

texts.es:
Si de esfuerzo y emprendurismo se quiere hablar, Meylin ha sido el ejemplo a seguir, puesto que orgullosa cuenta cómo ha salido adelante con su carrera de Tecnología Médica. Así mismo, expresa con emoción que gracias al préstamo anterior pudo pagar sus cursos de titulación y conseguir su título, con el cual se le abrieron puertas para trabajar en un laboratorio médico. 
A sus 26 años de edad, siente que la vida está empezando, por lo que debe aprovecharlo al máximo. Por esta razón, solicita un nuevo préstamo para emprender con su propio laboratorio, comprando microscopio, centrífugas, termómetros, conductómetros, medidores de pH, entre otros y así poder cumplir con una de sus metas para escalar hacia otro nivel profesional. En sus nuevos planes está formar más adelante su propia clínica. Sin embargo, por el momento comprará todos los equipos para el laboratorio.
texts.en:
If you want to talk about hard work and entrepreneurship, Meylin is a good example to follow, as she proudly explains how she has moved forwards with her degree in medical technology. She says with feeling that thanks to the previous loan, she was able to pay for her university graduation fees and obtain her degree. This opened doors for her to work in a medical laboratory.
 
At 26, she feels that life is just beginning, and that she should make the most of it. This is why she is requesting a new loan to set up her own laboratory, buying a microscope, centrifuges, thermometers, conductivity meters, pH measuring instruments, and other laboratory equipment, in order to achieve one of her goals and move up to the next professional level. 

One of her new plans is to set up her own clinic in the future. However, for the moment, she will buy all the equipment for the laboratory.

loans.use: to buy a microscope, centrifuges, thermometers, conductivity meters, pH measuring instruments, and other laboratory equipment.

loans.name: Aizhan

texts.ru: Айжан, 32 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает преподавателем, с 2004 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. В настоящее время у Айжан есть 1,50 Га земли, где выращивает картофель и фасоль для реализации , корова и 15 овец. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Айжан составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Она является участником группы "Ийгилик-3", всего в группе 3 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на подготовку земли к полевым работам и выращиванию органических овощей. Доходы от бизнеса помогут развить бизнес и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en: Aizhan, 32, is married and has three children. She has a university degree and works as a teacher. In addition, since 2004 she has been cultivating land and breeding livestock. She currently owns 1.50 ha of land where she grows haricot and potatoes for sale. She also has a cow and fifteen sheep. Her total monthly income is 15,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Aizhan is a member of the Iygilik-3 group, which consists of three borrowers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to prepare land for cultivation and growing organic vegetables. She plans to invest the profit in expanding her business and building sheds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers for land cultivation and growing organic products

loans.name: Keivin Jose

texts.es:
La pasión por ayudar a los demás defendiendo sus derechos, fue el motor de motivación de Keivin, un joven de 21 años de edad que estudia actualmente la licenciatura en Derecho. Afortunadamente este joven con grandes sueños cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, que trabaja en un centro de salud, y de su padre quien trabaja como mecánico automotriz. 
Keivin expresa lo feliz que se siente estar en el quinto año de su carrera universitaria, momento cuando más se le exige realizar trabajos de calidad. Por esta razón, es que solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora, que le ayudará a realizar sus trabajos investigativos y a redactar su tesis para concluir su carrera. En sus planes está hacer un postgrado en criminalística y más adelante establecer su propio bufete jurídico.
texts.en:
A passion for helping others defend their rights was the motivation for Keivin, 21, to study law.  Fortunately, this youth with great dreams has the support of his mother, who works in a health center, and his father, who works as an automotive mechanic.

Keivin states how happy he feels to be in his 5th year of university studies. At this time, he is facing the greatest requirement to do quality work.  This is why he is requesting a loan to buy a computer which will help him with his research work and to write his thesis to finish his degree.  He plans to get a post-graduate degree in criminology, and in the future, start up his own legal practice.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her brickmaking business for more income gain and to improve her family's living standards.

loans.name: Leidis Judith

texts.es:
Leidis es una experimentada vendedora de cerdos, lleva más de 15 años en el mercado, inicio siendo muy joven ya que tenía la necesidad de generar recursos para alimentar a su familia hoy en día conformada por sus dos hijos,  sus padres, y algunos sobrinos, Leidis ve su empresa como algo grande, su experiencia le ayuda a conseguir buenos clientes por lo que vende muy bien pero con el pasar del tiempo  sus cocheras se han deteriorado y piden a gritos que las reparen.
Leidis no había podido realizar esta operación porque no contaba con el capital suficiente para hacerlo.
Aprovechando el apoyo que en el momento la corporación Interactuar le está brindando quiere solicitar un préstamo no solo para organizar y adecuar sus cocheras que están desprotegidas contra ventisca o fuertes aguaceros, si no para aprovechar y comprar 7 cerdos y alimento para 3 meses, por tal razón el monto solicitado ya que cubrirá estas necesidad que de segura serán un aliciente para mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leidis is an experienced saleswoman.  She's been selling pigs in the market for more than 15 years.  She started the business when she was very young, because she needed to generate resources to feed her family.  Today, her family is comprised of her 2 children, her parents, and some nephews.  Leidis sees her business as something great; her experience enables her to have good customers, as she sells at very good prices.  However, over time her pigsties have deteriorated, and she is requesting a loan to repair them.

Leidis has not been able to do this because she has lacked the money to make the repairs.  Taking advantage of the support that INTERACTUAR is providing at this time, she wants to request a loan not only to organize and repair her pigsties, which are unprotected from snowstorms and severe rainstorms, but also to buy 7 pigs and 3 months of pig feed. The sum she is requesting will cover these needs, and this will surely be a stimulus to improve her sales and increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy pigs and repair her pigsty

loans.name: Eufemia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con 59 años de edad, Eufemia a trabajado fuerte para salir adelante con sus tres hijos, ahora independientes, pero que vieron el proceso de cómo vender en el mercado, hasta tener su propio negocio cercad el hogar. Fue entonces que esta comerciante ahora ya tiene cuatro años con su pulpería.
Afortunadamente, Eufemia cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo para cualquier paso que hace.  Ahora, para cambiar su estilo de vida y de aumentar la seguridad de su salud e higiene, solicita un préstamo para comprar inodoro, cemento, arena, adoquines, entre otros materiales y así terminar su baño.  En sus otros planes está más adelante seguir mejorando las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
At 59, Eufemia has worked hard to move forwards with her three children, who are now independent. They witnessed the process of how to sell in the market, until Eufemia got her own business near her home. This trader has now had a grocery store for four years.

Eufemia is lucky to be supported by her children and her husband in every step she takes. Now, to change her lifestyle and increase the security of her health and safety, she is requesting a loan to buy a toilet, cement, sand, paving stones, and other materials so that she can finish her bathroom. In the future, one of her plans is to continue improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, cement, sand, paving stones, and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sodas and other foods to sell in the market

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
For almost 2 years now, Patricia has been engaged in raising and selling hogs. She is a 35-year-old married woman with two young children residing in Alburquerque, Bohol.

Patricia is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, piglets and purchase cement for pigpen renovation. This will provide safety for the pigs and also improve the way she raises hogs. This will augment her income, and she will be able to set aside some savings. She will provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions. 

In the future, Patricia dreams of expanding her business to make it more productive and to build up a sari-sari (variety) store for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, piglets and purchase cement for pigpen renovation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and other foods to sell in the market

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old and supports a family of four members. She has been a small-scale farmer for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 11,500. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which she plans to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

She plans to use her profit to repay the loan and stabilize her farming. Her hope is to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old. For two years now, she has been operating a sari-sari store business, in which she sells basic household commodities like rice, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and seasoning.

She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks and chips. Her income will then be used to support her five children ranging in age from five to 14. In the future, she continues to hope that all her children will be successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks and chips

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hair chemicals, oil, powders and combs to serve her customers

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es:
Diana es una veterana de 50 años de edad, una persona muy centrada en su negocio, en su familia, le gusta el trabajo independiente una mujer que no se dejó vencer ente la falta de oportunidades para laborar y por su gusto a tener su negocio decidió iniciar con la venta de cerdos,  conforme iba pasando el tiempo la señora Diana identifico que este negocio tenia tiempos muertos que podría aprovechar en otras labores y como desde pequeña aprendió a usar máquina de confección decidió montar un negocio de sastrería.

Diana gracias a sus dos negocios ha podido elevar enormemente la calidad de vida de su familia, se siente orgullosa de lo que es y lo hace y espera seguir teniendo salud para realizar su profesión por muchos años más.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, igualmente quiere comprar telas para incursionar en la venta de sus propias prendas inicialmente las exhibirá en su hogar, si tienen buena acogida buscara la forma de venderlas en almacenes.

Diana con la utilidad que genera la invierte en un fondo de ahorro para atender eventualidades y está juntando capital para comprar una vivienda propia, la cual quiere dejarles de herencia a sus dos hijos.

Ayúdala, estimula su profesión.
texts.en:
Diana is a veteran who is 50 years old.  She is a person who is very focused on her business and her family.  She enjoys working independently, and she never gave up. Lacking job opportunities, and due to a desire to have her own business, she decided to start up a business selling pigs.  Over time, Diana realized that with this business she had some downtime that could be used for other work, and so since she had learned how to use a sewing machine when she was a child she decided to start up a dressmaking business.

Thanks to her two businesses, Diana has been able to greatly improve her family's quality of life.  She feels proud of what she does, and hopes to continue to have good health so that she can continue to work for many more years.  

Diana is requesting a loan to buy pigs and also to buy fabrics so that she can start up a line of her own garments to sell.  Initially, she will display these garments from her home, and if they are well accepted in the market she will try to sell the garments in stores.

With the profits she generates she will invest in a savings account to meet any future contingencies.  She is also saving money to buy her own house, which she will leave to her two children as an inheritance.

Help Diana to boost her business!

loans.use: to take the first steps in developing her own line of clothing to sell

loans.name: Wumiisyo Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is called Stella. She is forty years old, married, and blessed with three children. Two of her children are currently attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from enterprise development training.

Stella’s economic activity is poultry farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chicks, which will increase production of eggs and chickens for resale. This increase will ensure that she meets the growing demand for eggs and chicken and earns more income to cater to her family’s needs such as food and clothing.

Stella is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to increase production of eggs and chickens for resale to meet the growing demand for eggs and chicken.

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. She has owned a butchery for three years, where she serves delicious and fresh meat in order to help her husband financially and be able to always improve their lifestyle. Today she would like to request a loan from Kiva partner Vitas S.a.l to increase her inventory. She states that this loan will help her to maintain her loyal customers who always visit her to buy her appetizing and hygienic meat.

loans.use: to increase her butchery inventory

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, que tiene muchas expectativas de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Veronica, una de las integrantes de este grupo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chipa, el cual es un alimento tipo paraguayo. Hace sus ventas de manera ambulante, y tiene ya muy buena clientela, es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas de chipas, como ser: almidón, queso, manteca, huevos y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group is called Divino Niño and this is their first loan cycle in the committee of women program. It is a new group and they have high expectations of being able to improve their living conditions.
Veronica, one of the members of this group, earns a living making and selling chipas (cheese buns), which is a typical Paraguayan food. She sells these around the streets. She has a good clientele. She is a hard working woman and is above all determined.
She is asking for this loan to buy supplies to be able to continue selling her cheese buns, such as starch, cheese, butter, eggs and other things.
She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving by being able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy starch, cheese, butter, eggs and other things to make cheese buns to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Arielka De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Al platicar con Arielka, una leve sonrisa se dibuja en su cara cada vez que cuenta como ha salido adelante con su licenciatura en Banca y finanzas. esta joven de 22 años de edad, logró terminar sus estudios gracias al préstamo anterior, con el cual pagó su curso de titulación y pudo sacar su título y nombrarse oficialmente como Licenciada en Banca y Finanzas y asi contribuir con el desarrollo económico del país. Por esta razón es que ella se siente muy agradecida con todas las personas que le ayudaron a cumplir con esa meta. 
Esta joven luchadora cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, quien es enfermera y él es conductor de transporte pesado. Ahora Arielka quiere seguir cumpliendo sus sueños, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar una computadora y un proyector, puesto que el siguiente paso es realizar una especialidad, en la cual habrá diversos trabajos que ejecutar. En los planes de esta visionaria se encuentra hacer una maestría en finanzas.
texts.en:
Speaking with Arielka, a light smile is drawn across her face each time she tells how she has gotten ahead with her degree in banking and finance. This young 22 year old finished her studies thanks to a previous loan with which she paid for her schooling and was able to get a degree and officially obtain the title of Graduate in Banking and Finance, and in that way contribute to the economic development of the country. For this reason, she feels very grateful to all of the people who helped her achieve this goal.

This young, determined person has the support of her parents, her mother a nurse and her father a heavy transport driver. Now Arielka wants to continue achieving her dreams, which is why she requests a new loan to buy a computer and a projector, since the next step is to carry out a specialization in which there will be diverse jobs to execute. Among this visionary’s plans is getting a master’s in finance.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a projector.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 57 years of age and has six children. She joined Hand in Hand EA in 2012 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development. 

She operates a poultry business and is borrowing money to buy chicken feed that will increase egg and chicken production.  With increased stock, she will be able to meet her customer's demands.

She is grateful to KIVA and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed that will increase egg and chicken production.

loans.name: Farid Ignacio

texts.es:
Farid es un joven de 21 años de edad, patriota, comprometido, entusiasta y sonriente, esta apenas incursionando en el mundo del cultivo de plátano, vende principalmente dos productos que son el plátano y la hoja de plátano que es muy usada para envolver alimentos.

Farid quiere sobresalir en este gremio y aparte de su compromiso lo tiene que hacer ya que al iniciar su negocio se independizo totalmente vive solo y come de lo que produzca.

Su principal objetivo es sobrevivir, mantenerse, superarse, consolidarse y nuevamente mantenerse en ese orden de ideas quiere operar en su empresa.

Farid quiere solicitar un préstamo, la razón es que quiere aprovechar de mejor manera su terreno y plantara más árboles, por ello el préstamo será usado en la compra de semillas y abonos.
texts.en:
Farid is a young 21 year old who is patriotic, committed, enthusiastic, and smiling.  He is just starting out in the world of growing plantains. He mainly sells two products, which are plantain and plantain leaf, which is often used to wrap foods. 

Farid wants to get ahead in this profession. Apart from his commitment, he has to do it, since when he started his business he became totally independent. He lives and eats from what he produces.

His main objective is to survive, support himself, get ahead, become established, and once again support himself. He wants to operate his business along these lines.

Farid wants to request a loan. The reason is that he wants to take advantage of his land in a better way and plant more trees. For that reason, the loan will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to plant plantain trees and buy fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is called Ann. She is 31 years old, married and lives with her husband. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 with an aspiration to be trained and be able to gain economic and social power. 

She is taking a loan to buy fertilizer that will boost farming. This will lead to more income thus be in a position to cater for family needs.

 Ann is very grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will boost farming, thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a woman from the community of Kananga in Leyte. She is 43 years old, married with six children. Four if them are still dependents aged 12, 13, 14 and 17. 

Lorna relies on hog raising to earn a living for three years now. She decided to expand her business and currently she is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy piglets, feed, supplements, cement, hollow blocks, steel and hard wood. 

Lorna is confident that with an additional loan she can expand her business and provide for her family better.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, supplements, cement, hollow blocks, steel and hard wood

loans.name: Demelyn

texts.en:
Demelyn is a 25-year-old married woman from Ormoc City,  Leyte.  She has a young son and her husband work as a sales clerk. 

Demelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store business for eight years now. She sells items such as sugar, coffee, condiments, noodles, toiletries and canned goods. She also sells trendy clothing in her shop. 

She plans to increase her inventory such as candies, chips, canned goods and clothing through a loan that she is requesting from CEVI. Once her store is fully-stocked, she knows that her sales will also improve. 

In the future, Demelyn would like to expand her business to support her son's schooling.

loans.use: to buy candies, chips, canned goods and clothes, to support her son's schooling

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is thirty three years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training especially enterprise development. 

She operates a general retail shop where she sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap, cooking fat and other household goods. She is borrowing to buy more household goods to add stock to her general retail shop for increased income to meet her family's basic needs with ease.

Esther is grateful to kiva and her lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more household goods to add stock to her general retail shop, for increased income to meet her family's basic needs with ease.

loans.name: Nasibatkhon

texts.ru: Насибатхон, 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Насибатхон - средне-специальное образование, вместе с мужем она занимается животноводством и полеводством также есть собственное кафе и баня. Благодаря упорному труду Насибатхон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 15 овец. На 1,0 Га выращивает ячмень. В кафе наработаны постоянные посетители, в бане также - хорошая клиентура. Ежемесячный доход Насибатхон составляет 27,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Насибатхон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на проведение ремонта и благоустройство кафе, также на приобретения товара для кафе. Доходы от кредита Насибатхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nasibatkhon is 45 years old and married, and has four children with her husband.  She has a high school education and together with her husband she works raising livestock and farming. They also have their own cafe and bathhouse. Thanks to her tenacious work, Nasibatkhon currently has three cows and fifteen sheep on her farm. She also grows barley on her one hectare plot.  Their cafe has many regular customers and the bathhouse also has a good client base. Nasibatkhon's monthly income is 27,000 KGS. In order to further develop her business, Nasibatkhon turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS for renovations on the cafe and to ourchase products for the cafe. She plans to invest her income in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy products and make improvements in her cafe

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 27-year-old woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has two children ages 6 and 8. Her husband works in Manila to provide for them. 	

She in turn helps by raising hogs to earn a living. For six years this is has been her business and allows her to earn about 3000 PHP per month. She is asking a loan to buy feed, piglets, supplements and pay for vaccination. Jessica hope to make her business a success for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, supplements and pay for vaccination, for her children's future

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa, 42, and her fourteen-year-old son live in Ormoc City. For the past five years she has operated a carenderia, which is a small restaurant attached to a home in the Philippines. From it she makes approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Living on this income is quite a challenge for Gausiosa, as she is the only one who provides for her son. She is asking for a 8,000 PHP loan through Kiva’s field partner CEVI to buy chicken meat, cooking oil and spices for her business. She hopes to have a bigger restaurant in a better location someday.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat, cooking oil and spices

loans.name: Jane Amor

texts.en:
Jane Amor is 56 years old, married and has three children. She is engaged in a food stall business to earn a living and provide her children's daily needs. She wants to increased her income. That is why she needs financial assistance to buy additional ingredients for a new menu to sell, so she decided to take a loan again.

Jane Amor wants for the future to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for a new menu to sell, to sustain the needs of her family

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Melisa is 30 years old and both of her children are in school.

Melisa has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Melisa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Melisa would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Nympha

texts.en:
Nympha is 47 years old and married with three children. All of them are attend school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Nympha is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nympha has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.  This way she can send her children to school

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 65 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Tomasa has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Tomasa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

Tomasa has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Tomasa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall and expand her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 58 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosita has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. To secure the future of her family

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old, a resident of Gayaza in the rural Rakai District of Kyotera, Uganda.  He is married and has 9 children, 8 of which attend school.  He also cares for 2 children that are orphans.  He is a farmer growing coffee and other crops, which he started doing in 1997 with the aim of looking after his family.  In addition to that, he also trades in coffee and ground nuts.  John works 6 days a week and 10 hours per day.

John is interested in a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to buy organic fertilizers for his coffee plantation.  His major customers are the coffee processing factories. He is faced with a challenge of limited capital, and climatic changes such as drought.

John is a hard working man who always wants to see his family have a quality standard of living, and is hoping to increase his coffee plantations.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, she engaged in a transport business to provide the daily needs of her family and help her husband to earn an income. 

Able to continue cater for more passengers in her transport business, she needs to renew her motorcycle registration. Tha is why she needs in financial assistance. Recently, she decided to take a loan to pay for motor registration.

Elsie wants for the future to buy a new motorcycle for expansion her business.

loans.use: To pay for her motor cycle registration to be able to continue in business

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea, 34, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children .To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and sells the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for thirty five years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day, on average.  

Now she wants to open a grocery store to serve people in her community. However, the limited capital doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she would like to apply for a Kiva loan and she will use this loan as capital to open a grocery store. She would like to thank for all lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to open a grocery store to serve people in her community

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 61-year-old woman from Ormoc City who, despite her age, works very hard. For the past thirteen years she has raised chickens and hogs to make a living. She earns about 2000 PHP per month from doing so.

Lorna is asking for a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva’s field partner CEVI to buy more piglets, feed and supplements and pay for vaccinations to keep her animals healthy. Once her new piglets are set, Lorna will concentrate on managing them well for a better return on her investments. She wants to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, plus feed, supplements and vaccinations for them

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 59 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Anita has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs, to secure the future for her family

loans.name: Barceliza

texts.en:
Barceliza is 56 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming corn and vegetables in the Philippines. Barceliza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Barceliza has been farming corn and vegetables for four years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm, to save enough to be able to buy more farm land

loans.name: Agustihna

texts.en:
Agustinha is 36 years and she is married.She is married and has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. 

She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1.000.00.  She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as candles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk water, fanta, sagiko (fruit drinks), slippers, fish, biscuits and soap. 

She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy candle, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, water, fanta, sagiko (fruit drinks),slippers, fish, biscuits and soap

loans.name: Marydel

texts.en:
Marydel is 57 years old. For twenty years now, she has been operating a Sari-sari store business and food vending business in her place of Ormoc City. In her store she sell basic household commodities like rice, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and seasoning. 

She is asking a loan to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, chips and spices. Her income will then be used for a healthy diet, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, chips and spices, for savings and re-investment in her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 55-year-old woman from Kananga, Leyte. She is married and all her children are grown. Like most residents, Wilma find her livelihood through hog raising. She also farms rice to earn a living. Hog raising has been her business for two years now. Wilma is struggling to meet the feed requirement to keep her hogs healthy. 

She is requesting for a loan to buy sacks of feed to fatten them. She hope that with the loan she can then focus on taking care of her hogs and ensuring that they are well-fed for a better return on her investment. Her income will be for food and savings.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten her hogs so as to achieve a good return on her investment

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is a hard-working and diligent woman. She never stops pursuing her goals: to support her family, especially her grandchildren, and see her business thrive.

Leoncia is doing well selling rice cake snacks that she makes herself. She spends a lot of time perfecting her rice cake recipe. She has now taken out a 6,000 PHP loan through Kiva’s field partner PMPC to buy additional ingredients for her rice cakes so she can serve more customers and be able to accept more orders.

Leoncia is working on another snack cake recipe in an effort to further increase sales. She hopes and prays that her business will grow for the benefit of her family, especially her grandchildren

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her homemade rice cakes

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis lives in Tudela and supports his two children by building a house from the ground up. He has availed a previous loan and successfully repaid it in a timely manner.

Now he applied another loan to purchase materials for a house renovation. He wants his children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work he has had to endure.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Jehan

texts.en:
Jehan is 33 years old from Minia. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a taxi motorcycle driver but the income he makes can't cover the family's expenses. 

Five years ago, Jehan started a clothing project in her house to help her husband with the family income. Her project became very successful and she dreams of expanding it. So, she requested a 3000 EGP loan to buy more clothing for her project, to meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her project, to meet the demand from her customers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is forty two years old, married and a mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training on enterprise development and financial management.

She practices poultry farming and is a borrowing Kiva loan to buy more chickens and chicken feeds. This will enable her increase production of her poultry farming business hence increased income to support basic family needs and education for her children.

Rose is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support; she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and chicken feeds to increase production of her poulty farming business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from personal products.  Joyce is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of clothes to resell.

Joyce has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothes to resell and secure the future of her family

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 59 years old. She is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Adelina has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items such as towels, curtains, blouses, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Adelina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Adelina would like to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items such as towels, curtains, blouses, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 30 years old from Minia. He is married with a son, whom he taught butchery in a very early age. 

4 years ago Ahmad started his own butchery project but the income from the project is very low and can't cover his family's monthly basic needs. So he requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy more meat to increase his sales and meet his costumers increasing demands.

loans.use: To buy more meat to increase his sales and meet his costumers increasing demands

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, 56, is a resident of the town of Kananga, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells items like noodles, biscuits, chips, candies, canned goods, and toiletries. She has been running a store for 10 years now.  She is married with 2 dependents ages 20 and 21 year old respectively.

She has requested a loan to buy assorted groceries for the store, like soft drinks, beverages and other basic goods. These are tools that would enhance her business to be productive. Her income will slowly improve and able to handle her finances. With these, she could do some  expansion in order that her income would grow.

Concepcion hopes that she will be  successful in handling her business to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for the store, to enhance her business to be productive

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2012, and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She has a small piece of farmland near her home. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP. This loan is intended to buy farm supplies and fertilizer to start her vegetable and crops growing project. Estrella dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and fertilizer to start her vegetable and crops growing project.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a diligent and hardworking mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. 

She wants to purchase additional grocery items for her sari-sari (small grocery) store. This way, she will be able to sell more goods, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her sari-sari (small grocery) store, to earn money

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from raising livestock.

Helen dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies to save enough to buy more farmland

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 30 years old. She is married and has one child who is in school. 

Jenalyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jenalyn has been raising pigs for two years.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and has five children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for two years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maria Lyn

texts.en:
Maria Lyn is 26 years old, married and has one child who is in school. 

Maria Lyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Maria Lyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

Maria Lyn has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Lyn would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm, to save enough to buy more farm land

loans.name: Rea Joy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rea Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a personal care products retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruits. Rea Joy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like body-lotion, perfume and other beauty products to resell for her personal care products business.

Rea Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like body-lotion, perfume and other beauty products to resell, so that she earns enough to send her children to school

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalie has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies to save money to expand her business

loans.name: Santander

texts.es:
