Santander es un hombre de 48 años de edad, un campesino tradicional, es padre de 6 hijos, vive junto con su pareja e hijos en una residencia típica, se dedica a las artesanías con paja, esta profesión se la enseño sus padres y la ha realizado desde el año 1975, muchos años de recorrido pasando por tiempos difíciles, tiempos bellos, su principal volumen de ventas se presenta en épocas de fiestas donde extranjeros valoran mucho su trabajo y le pagan bien por este.

Santander siempre ha sido la persona que trabaja, el lleva todos los recursos, sus hijos pueden estar orgulloso de un hombre que pasa hasta 14 horas laborando para que su familia goce de una buena alimentación.

En este momento el señor Santander se encuentra trabajando para realizar bellas creaciones como sombreros, sillas, instrumentos, utensilios en este material puesto que la feria de flores celebrada en Medellín.

Pensando en que esta feria puede representar buenas entradas de dinero Santander quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de paja e hilo en cantidad todo para estar listo cuando el evento comience.
texts.en:
Santander is a 48-year-old man: a traditional man from the country.  He is the father of six children.  He lives together with his wife and children in a typical home.  He works making crafts out of straw.  His parent taught him this profession, and he has been doing this work since 1975—a stretch of years that strung along through bad times and beautiful times.  His biggest volume of sales occurs during the festival seasons where foreigners admire his work and pay him well for it.

Santander has always been a person who works.  He takes care of the necessities.  His children can be proud of a man who spends up to 14 hours working so that his family can be well fed.

At this point in time, Santander can be found working to make his beautiful creations such as hats, chairs, instruments, and utensils from this material, given that the festival of flowers is celebrated in Medellín.

Thinking that this festival represents good earnings, Santander wants to ask for a loan for the purchase of straw and thread in sufficient quantities to be all ready when the event begins.

loans.use: to buy straw and supplies in order to make hats, chairs, instruments, and utensils from that material for the festival of flowers celebrated in Medellín

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl has been in the hog raising business for almost 8 years now. She lives in Kananga, Leyte. Aside from raising hogs, she also engages in direct selling business. She sells Natasha products (Catalog sales), like apparel, house hold and various foot wear items. She is married with four dependents aged 6-18 year old.

She is asking a loan to buy pig feed and supplement.  With these, she could now purchase variety of Natasha products like body spray, ladies apparel to be delivered to her respective customers. Thus, providing her children with good food and better shelter to live.

She could also continue to manage her hog raising business to become productive.

Cheryl is determined to be successful in handling her both business for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to purchase Natasha products (catalog sales)  and buy pig feed and supplement for the welfare of her children

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
For  years now, Gina operates a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells item ranging from canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, condiments and toiletries. She is married woman with six-year old son. Her husband earns a living by being a construction worker. 

She is asking a loan  to buy groceries, biscuits and soft drinks. With these, her sari-sari store will enhance its content as this will cause to attract more buyers to come. Thus, slowly, her earnings will improve and she could now prepare healthy diets to the whole family.

Gina is very optimistic that she will be handling her business properly for brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy groceries, biscuits and soft drinks, to enhance its content to attract more customers

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 47 years old, married and has three children. One of whom is in school.

Ma. Fe is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Fe has been farming rice for ten years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies, to afford to send her children to college

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 25 years old, married and has one kid. 

Marivel is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marivel requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marivel has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marivel would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies, to save money in order to buy more land for farming

loans.name: Ediana

texts.en:
A $1000.00 is offered to Ediana to improve her business.She is married and she has four children and  she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as  shampoo,soap,sugar,coffee,salt and biscuits.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Ediana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. And her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee, salt and biscuits to be responsible for herself and her family

loans.name: Victorino

texts.en:
Victorino prepares and sells home meals to the local in his place. He sells home-made meals like, fish soup, chicken adobe, stewed vegetables and many other native menu. He has been running a food vending business for 2 years now. He is married with 2 dependents ages 6 and 18 year old.

Victorino has requested a loan to buy supplies like chicken, vegetables, spices.  These ingredients will be used in the preparation of meals. With these, he could now have a variety of menus, to attract more buyers to come. Thus, his income will improve and he could now provide for the needs of his children.

He is hoping that he could properly manage his existing business to become successful in the future to come.

loans.use: to buy supplies like chicken, vegetables, spices, etc. to attract new customers with a new menu

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 46 years old, married and has six children. One of whom is in school.

Elvie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Elvie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs to secure the future of her family

loans.name: Bebita

texts.en:
Bebita is 52 years old, married with two children.

Bebita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Bebita has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for thirty years and also earns an income from clothing sales and fattening pigs.

Bebita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell, to expand her business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is from Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is 56 years old and is married with three children. She has a retail business, buying and selling bananas. In 2012, she applied for her membership in Paglaum-Multi Purpose Cooperative in order to seek financial services and insurances. Since then, she has been a good member and repays her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for financial assistance in the amount of 25,000 PHP to finance farming activities such as leveling and cleaning of dikes and buying of farm inputs. She has found assistance for her family's financial needs through PMPC and is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to finance farming activities such as leveling and cleaning of dikes and buying of farm inputs

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael hails in the town of Kananga, Leyte.  He is 37 year old married man with 3 young dependents..He operates a sari-sari(variety) store.  He sells items ranging from biscuits, cooking oil, canned goods, soap, beverages and soft drinks. He has been running a store for 3 years now. 

Rafael is asking a loan to buy assorted stocks for the store, such as, condiments, beverages and toiletries.  These resources are very essentials in augmenting Rafael's livelihood. Thus, it will cause to improve her daily earnings and able toe settle his obligations.

With the resources at hand, He is determined to handle his sari-sari (variety) store business properly to become successful.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store to become more successful

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina has always dreamed of having a concrete structure of piggery for her hogs to support her three children. 

She used her loan to build a concrete pig pens. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: To build new concrete pig pens to increase her profits

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married and makes a good earning with every cropping on her farm in Aloran, in the Philippines. This is her means of supporting their family with her husband. Elsie has been able to provide her children with a good education. 

Elsie pawned her 2-hectare coconut land when she was experiencing financial insufficiency, pursuing her children to get a degree in college. 

Now, she wishes to access a PMPC loan to pay for the acquisition of her pawned coconut land. Elsie has high hopes that she will have a higher yield on her farm next cropping, and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of her pawned coconut land

loans.name: Kirk

texts.en:
Kirk has started his small time business and became a boss with his sari-sari store. He has manage to have enough inventories and rolls up his capital to gain more profit. Everyday he made good sales since he is the only store in their barangay. 

Recently he approached Paglaum for his much needed capital to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items, to be able to build a home for the family

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 68 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children are sent to school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Emelda has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling sea shells.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs, so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans. Thérèse vit avec ses six enfants à Kpota. Thérèse vend des friperies en se promenant au marché et trouve son bénéfice grâce à ce commerce. Thérèse s’approvisionne au marché six fois par mois pour avoir en permanence son stock. Pour avoir une nouvelle commande, Thérèse sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des habits pour femme et vendre à ses clients afin de  réaliser plus de bénéfice pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en:
Thérèse is a 43-year old married woman. She lives with her six children in Kpota.

Thérèse sells second-hand clothes itinerantly at the market, and creates her revenues thanks to this business. She procures her supplies from the market six times a month, to permanently have some stock.

To place a new order, Thérèse is requesting a loan for women’s clothing. She will retail them to her clients to increase her profits and support her children with getting an education.

loans.use: to buy four dozen clothes.

loans.name: Nerina

texts.en:
Nerina is 56 years old and a widow. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Nerina has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Nerina requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Nerina has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Nerina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill, so as to expand her business

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo es un joven de 23 años de edad, es un hombre muy disciplinado, entregado al trabajo y a sus padres, decidió, trabaja en el campo, como monta cargas pero cansado de estas profesiones que demanda tanto esfuerzo físico por tal mala remuneración económica.

En el año 2010 fue que tomo la iniciativa y se volvió independiente, dedicándose a la cría de cerdos, la profesión que le enseñaron e inculcaron sus padres.

Adolfo busca mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ayudar a sus padres, uno de ellos una persona incapacitada, encargarse de las labores familiares, su buen corazón y excelente disposición para el trabajo son los que lo ayudaran a crecer y ser un gran empresario.

Adolfo solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimento para cerdos, busca abastecerse para un periodo de 4 meses, al comprarlo en cantidad será mas económico y más abundante.
texts.en:
Adolfo, 23, is a very disciplined man who is devoted to his work and his parents. He decided to work in the fields lifting bales, but he tired of this work that demands so much physical effort for such minimal pay.

In 2010, he took the initiative to start working independently raising pigs.  He was taught this line of work by his parents.

Adolfo is seeking to improve the condition of his house and help his parents, one of whom is disabled.  He is in charge of the household tasks, and with his good heart and willingness to work he is growing and becoming a good businessman.  

Adolfo is requesting a loan to buy 4 months of pig feed.  By purchasing in bulk, it will be cheaper and more plentiful.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Jenevie

texts.en:
Jenevie is 34 years old from Oroquieta. She and her husband have been farmers, focusing on planting rice, corn, vegetables, and root crops. This is how they earn a living for their own family. 

As a new member of PMPC, she is requesting a PHP 7,000 loan to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost for her crops and vegetables farm. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and to be able to engage in agricultural business ventures.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost for her crops and vegetables farm

loans.name: Emeldena

texts.en:
Emeldena engages in raising poultry animals like native chickens. She has been raising and selling native chickens for 3 years now. She is 34 year old married woman with six young dependents. Her husband earns a living by means of farming.

She is taking a loan to buy additional native chickens and feeds. With these, Emeldena's livelihood will surely augment and in few months to come, she would be able to sell more quantity of native chickens.  Thus, she could prepare healthy diets for the whole family.

She is grateful for availing the funds, and in return she is determined to expand her poultry raising business to become successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional native chickens and feeds, to expand her business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a snack food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more snack foods to resell.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to resell and thus expand her business for the future of her family

loans.name: Gustavo Enrique

texts.es:
Gustavo un hombre que le entrego gran parte de su vida al campo, que se desempeñó como mayordomo, trabajador en cultivos, hoy se encuentra dando un paso muy importante en su vida, fue tomar la decisión de volverse independiente algo que le sugerían mucho, pero nunca lo quiso hacer quizás por temor o no, solo él sabela razón.

Por la disminución en labores operativas del campo se quedó sin trabajo y a esto se debe la decisión de iniciar su propia empresa que será muy parecidos a las labores que realizaba como mayordomo en finca, por ello se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual construirá y surtida un galpón de pollos.

El negocio es también pro necesidad tiene una familia a la cual alimentar, en su casa, espera su pareja y sus dos hijos.

Apoya a este empresario del campo que quedo desempleado y busca de alguna manera generar recursos para el mantenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a man who has devoted much of his life to working in the fields. He has worked as a farm supervisor. Today he is taking a very important step in his life; he has decided to start his own business.  This is something that he has thought about doing, but never did, perhaps out of fear or not, only he knows the reason why.

Facing diminishing opportunities in farm work which left him without work, he decided to start his own company that will be very similar to the work he did as a supervisor on a farm. To do this he is requesting a loan to build and stock a barn with chickens. 

He needs this business to feed his family; his household includes his partner and their 2 children.

Support this rural entrepreneur who has been left unemployed and is seeking another way to generate income to support his family.

loans.use: to start a business raising chickens

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans et divorcée, Abra est une femme qui habite à Adamavo avec ses deux enfants. Abra est une revendeuse de fruits et de l’igname frite dans son quartier pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Cette activité permet à Abra d’avoir une bonne épargne pour investir dans la vie éducative de ses enfants. Abra s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Abra demande ce crédit pour commander des fruits, des ignames et des cartons de spaghettis. Grâce au bénéfice, Abra souhaite améliorer ses prestations et bien s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aged thirty and divorced, Abra is a woman living in Adamavo with her two children.

Abra retails fruits and fried yams in her neighborhood to satisfy her clients. This business allows her to have good savings to invest in her children’s educational life. Abra gets her supplies three times a month at the market.

Abra is requesting this loan to order fruits, yams, and boxes of spaghetti. Thanks to the profits, she wants to improve her services and take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy a quantity of yams, two boxes of spaghetti, and one bucket of oranges.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Yawavi est une femme veuve qui habite dans le quartier d’Adamavo. Mère d’un enfant, Yawavi vend des produits alimentaires dans son quartier afin de gagner son revenu et répondre favorablement aux besoins de sa famille. Pour renouveler son stock, Yawavi s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Dans le but de commander des bols de maïs, des cartons de spaghettis et des bols du haricot, Yawavi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat tirer plus de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Yawavi is a widow living in the Adamavo district. A mother of one, she sells food products in her neighborhood to generate revenues and meet her family’s needs.

To restock, Yawavi procures supplies three times a month at the market. To order bowls of corn, boxes of spaghetti, and bowls of beans, Yawavi is requesting this loan. She wants to make this purchase to generate greater profits.

loans.use: to buy 50 bowls of corn, three boxes of spagetti, and ten bowls of beans.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth wants to earn a living to support her family needs. That's why she engaged in a transport business with the help of her husband. Her husband is the one who drives the motorcycle for greater income. 

She needs financial assistance to purchase motor parts for motorcycle repair, so she borrowed again a loan amounting P 17,500.00.

Elizabeth wants for the future to expand her business to sustain the educational needs for her children.

loans.use: To purchase motor parts for motorcycle repair, to sustain the educational needs for her children

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sea foods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling coconut vinegar.

Emma dreams that one day, She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy more seafoods to sell, so as to expand her business for the future of her family

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Ayoko est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans qui vit dans le quartier d’Adamavo pour entreprendre son activité. Ayoko vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans sa boutique. Ayoko s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Ayoko demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de farine et du maïs afin de bien vendre et avoir plus de bénéfice. Ayoko désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ayoko is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in the neighborhood named Adamavo, where she started her business.

Ayoko sells groceries in her store. She procures her supplies four times a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to order bowls of flour and corn to sell well and increase her profits.

Ayoko wants to make a profit to help her husband with the family’s expenses and to allow her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy thirty bowls of flour and forty bowls of corn.

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en:
Mrs. Kartini, a mother of four grown up children, and the grandmother of two, sells Nazava Water Filters in Surabaya, a big city in the East of Java, Indonesia. In Surabaya, you cannot drink the city water. Over 50 % of the population relies on well water which is of poor quality. Therefore, she started selling water filters so that people can filter their own well, tap or rainwater and treat it so they can drink it without the need for boiling. 

This is the second loan for Mrs Kartini. She repaid the previous one before the due date. 

Mrs. Kartini is very upbeat about the prospects and wants to use this loan to purchase about 70 water filters providing safe drinking water to 350 people.

loans.use: to purchase water filters for her water filter business, to provide safe water to 350 people

loans.name: Agbowougbo

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans et veuve, Agbowougbo est une femme qui habite à Adamavo avec ses quatre enfants. Agbowougbo est une revendeuse de fruits et des produits d’alimentations dans son quartier pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Cette activité permet à Agbowougbo d’avoir une bonne épargne pour investir dans la vie éducative de ses enfants. Agbowougbo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Agbowougbo demande ce crédit pour commander des fruits des bols de farine. Grâce au bénéfice, Agbowougbo souhaite améliorer ses prestations et bien s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aged 48 and widowed, Agbowougbo is a woman living in the neighborhood named Adamavo with her four children.

Agbowougbo retails fruits and groceries in her neighborhood to satisfy her clients. This business allow her to have good savings to invest in her children’s educational life. She procures her supplies three times a month at the market.

Agbowougbo is requesting this loan to order fruits and bowls of flour. Thanks to her profits, Agbowougbo wants to improve her services and take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of bananas and twenty-seven bowls of flour.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 53 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rebecca has been farming sugarcane for 18 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for sugarcane, in order to save money to buy more farmland

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 34 years old and married with two children who are both in school.

She earns a living by raising chicken in the Philippines. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her chicken.

Marjorie has been raising chicken for ten years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her chicken, so as to send her children to school.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 51 years old, married with nine children. Three of her children are in school.

Nemia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nemia has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nemia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, to continue to send her children to school

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Ella es Diana una futura empresaria de 34 años de edad, una madre soltera y cabeza de familia de dos hijos una de 8 y otro de 6, recibe ayuda de sus padres pero solo lo suficiente por ello con determinación y con mucha esperanza desea iniciar su propio negocio que será la venta de calzado para su dama y requiere mucho de tu ayuda pues busca un préstamo que le permita comprar surtido de calzado principalmente sandalias  y tener una vitrina en su casa, este préstamo significara darle la oportunidad a una madre de luchar por el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
She is Diana, a 34-year-old future businesswoman. She is a single mother and the head of a family of two children, one who is 8 and the other 6.  She receives help from her parents, but only what is sufficient. That's why, with determination and a lot of hope, she wants to start her own business which will be selling women's footwear. 

And she really needs your help, so she is seeking a loan that will allow her to buy an assortment of footwear, primarily sandals, and to have a display case in her house. This loan signifies the opportunity for a mother to fight for the future of her family.

loans.use: to start selling footwear by buying an assortment and a display case to exhibit in her home. She will primarily sell sandals

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy, the oldest son of a fishermen family in Neang Sav village, earns a living by fishing, to support his old mother and a younger sibling. In order to reduce costs buying fishing equipment, Vuthy and mother spend the night time making fishing equipment. They always have difficult working at night because their current energy (a car battery) is a time and money consuming source. Vuthy has to go to charge the battery 3 or 4 times per week or else they can't work at night. Moreover, his youngest sister also needs the light to study at night. 

As a result, Vuthy decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes with a sustainable source like a solar home system, he has no worries about a lack of energy to work at night and his sister's education condition. Furthermore, he can save utility fee. His family also can live in a better condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system, for the benefit of his family and his sister's education

location.town: Neang Sav Village, Kampong Svay Commune, Phat Sond

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo is the father of 5 children at the age of 53. He owns and manages his transport business to earn income and be able to provide for his family needs. As part of motorcycle maintenance he needs to purchase spare parts and tires for motor maintenance to continue carrying passengers and increase his income.

To purchase the spare parts and tires he availed a loan again amounting PHP 14,000.00.

Arnulfo wants for the future to buy new motorcycle for expansion of his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and tires for motor bike maintenance

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a 58 years old, widowed and has eight children to provide for. She is the only one who provides for her children and is able to sustain the needs of her family.  She is engaged in a rice production business but she needs financial assistance to make her rice farm more productive. 

Recently, she decided to take a loan again to buy fertilizer for the rice farm for the purpose to generate more income.

Jessie wants for the future to buy new ricefields for expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the rice farm in order to generate more income

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old, married and has one children. She is engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn for living and to help her husband also for living. 

Gina wants to increase her store inventory and increase her income so she needs to purchase additional goods to sell to have more sales to generate more income. To make this she availed herself of a loan again amounting PHP 8,000.00.

Gina wants for the future to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell to sustain the needs of her family

loans.name: Laziza

texts.en:
Laziza is an active woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living in a rural area with her family. The area where she lives is good for hunting and tourists who want to enjoy and cherish the blossom in its season. She is married and has two children. 

She heard and was informed about IMON from mess media. She decided to do business in agriculture because it is good business in her village. She is generous, hardworking and capable person. Her family is poor and they live from the income of her husband working in agriculture. She wants to support and help her family to add to their family budget and live better. 

She appealed to IMON and asked for help; she was supported and allowed to get a startup loan product, because it is her first business. She asked a financial support to buy agricultural seeds and livestock. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy agricultural seeds and livestock for the improvement of her family budget

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en:
Zebiniso is an active woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She is living in rural area with her family. She is married and has three children. She is generous, honest and capable person. She was interested to IMON’s training to startup clients and wanted to participate in order to know better how to do business and earn money to living. Her husband works in Russia and she feels responsibility to feed their family. She has an experience doing business in agriculture. The season was dry and she could not gain a harvest last year. 

After participation at training she decided to do business with buying, feeding and selling livestock. Recently, she is planning to buy livestock and start a new business. She asked a loan from Kiva lender to buy livestock. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a new business

loans.name: Nao's Group

texts.en:
Nao, 27, is a mother of two children, living in Siem Reap province. The sources of her family’s income are rice farming and feeding pigs for sale. She has been involved in these businesses for seven years and it earns her about 34,700KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan via VisionFund to buy farming supplies for her farming. She hopes to earn more money through this loan.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to earn more money

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en:
Mr Wahyu sells water filter systems in his hometown in Central Java. 

There is a real need for water filters because you cannot drink the tap water in Indonesia and most people do not even have a tap, relying on well water instead. 

Nazava Water Filters make dirty well, tap and rain water safe to drink water without the need for boiling, without using electricity. This is Wahyu’s third loan, he repaid the previous ones on time. 

In the coming months Wahyu will focus on building a network of sales agents and selling water filters on credit which will allow poorer households to buy them as well. 

This loan will enable Mr Wahyu to buy around 300 water filters that can deliver truly safe drinking water to 1500 people.

loans.use: to purchase 300 water filters that provide safe drinking water to 1500 people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hogs to raise, and to use for the repair of hog pens.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years a resident of Manyama in Rakai district, single father with 5 children 4 attending school.
 
Joseph deals in the business of making bark cloth which he started in 2004 with the aim of improving on his daily income. Bark cloth is a traditional kind of cloth made from trees, but used for traditional functions.
He also carries out farming where he grows tomatoes that he sells to supplement his income.
  
Joseph works 6 days in a week and 12 hours per day, and he needs a loan of UGX3,000,000/= to buy more stock for his business so as to meet the demands for his customers.
His hope is to establish a point in the busy centre like Kampala where his customers can find his products easily.
 
Joseph’s major customers are the people from different areas especially for burials. However, he faces challenges of inadequate capital and competition in the market.  He describes himself as honest and hardworking gentleman who appreciates the services provided to him by lenders and always to lend him money when he needs it..

loans.use: To buy traditional bark cloth material that he will modify to fit his customer needs and then sell it

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 40 years old, married and has two children. To earn for living and help her husband to provide for the children's needs, she is engaged in a food vending business. 

Mary Grace wants to increase her income but she needs a financial assistance to purchase additional ingredients for a new menu to sell, so she decided to avail a loan amounting P 20,000.00 for the purpose of increasing her family income.

Mary Grace plans to save money from her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her new menu to sell and provide for the needs of her family

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 52-year-old married woman with two grown dependents. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various goods such as biscuits, candies, noodles, seasonings, and toiletries. She has been operating a sari-sari store for almost ten years now. She is in need of capital to continue to operate her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy groceries for the store, such as condiments, beverages and assorted canned goods. It will enhance the content of her store and enable her to attract more buyers to come. Thus, her income will be augmented, and she will be able to settle her finances.

She is hopeful to expand her business for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a mother of three children at the age of 46. She wants to help her husband with their living, so she engaged in a transport business. Someone will rent their motorcycle and pay for the rent. Out of the rent, she earns income.

As part of the motorcycle maintenance, she needs financial assistance to purchase spare parts for motor maintenance. So, she decided to take a loan of PHP 10,000 for her motorcycle maintenance and to be able to cater to more passengers.

Analiza wants to have a new motorcycle for expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Hermenia is 29 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Hermenia has a general store business in the Philippines. Hermenia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack food, noodles, and other personal care products.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Hermenia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack food, noodles, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 62 years old, married, with three children. She is a very hard- working entrepreneur. 

Judith has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Judith has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming by using certified seeds and improved fertilizers

loans.name: Etis Edith

texts.es:
Etis es una mujer alegre, perseverante, luchadora y convincente, su negocio de venta de víveres y abarrotes ha sido su fortaleza, su apoyo y gracias a este a mejorado sus condiciones de vida, ella se proyecta para mejorar, quiere tener una vivienda propia, convertir su tienda en un mini mercado, acercar y familiarizar a las personas de las zonas rurales con productos usados comúnmente en la ciudad, ese es su sueño y su meta.

Tú puedes ayudar a cumplirla, apoyando a Etis en un préstamo que se encuentra solicitando para surtir su negocio, la razón del monto es que todos los productos los trae de la ciudad con la misma intención de familiarizarlos con las marcas y abarrotes usados sin descuidar cuales son los productos mayormente consumidos en la región.
texts.en: Etis is a happy, persevering, hardworking and convincing woman. Her business of selling food items and grocery products has been her strength, her support, and thanks to it she has improved her life conditions. She plans to improve; she wants to have her own house, to change her store into a mini-market, and to bring products used commonly in the city and introduce them to the people of rural areas. This is her dream and goal. You can help her fulfill it, supporting Etis with a loan that she is requesting to stock up her business. The reason of the amount requested is that she is bringing all products from the city with the purpose of introducing new brands and groceries, without neglecting those mostly consumed regional products.

loans.use: to go to the city and stock up with basic staple products so that her customers can have all types of products available.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto earns a livelihood by engaging in a butane vending business. He is 36-year-old man with a 6-year-old dependent.  He also engages in selling "amakan" or (bamboo) matting. He resides in Kananga, Leyte.

He is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of butane and amakan. This will permit him to have more supplies of butane ready for sale and will allow him to slowly increase his income and be able to handle his finances and support the needs of his growing child.

Ernesto hopes that he can be successful in managing his livelihood for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of butane and amakan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava flour, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Niso

texts.en: Niso is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is living in a village with her family. She is a responsible, hardworking and generous person. She is married and has one child. She was interested in the training for startup clients provided by IMON and wanted to participate and learn how to do business. She participated in the Startup training and got the necessary information to do business. She has had experience in agriculture from a young age. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy calves to start doing a new business. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy calves to start doing a new business

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: 48 летняя женщина Фируза. Она уроженка района Шахритус. Фируза живет вместе мужем и детьми. Детям 12, 17 и 20 лет. Муж находится на заработках загранице, чтобы обеспечить семью. Фируза дехканка. Она у себя во дворе занимается животноводством и земледелием. У нее имеется коровник, где она выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Фируза еще выращивает арбуз и дыня. Она хорошо справляется обоими делами. Она любить заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Ей на работе помогает дети. Фируза покупает молодых телят и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Сейчас Фируза планирует расширить деятельность животноводство и земледелие. Она запрашивает кредит для купли несколько молодых телят и семян арбуз. Запрашиваемый кредит пожжет ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Firuza is 48 years old. She is a native of the Shahrituz region. Firuza lives with her husband and three children, who are 12, 17, and 20 years old. Her husband currently works abroad to support the family. Firuza is a farmer. She works in animal husbandry and agriculture on her own farm. She has a cowshed where she raises cattle.  She also grows melons and watermelons. She does well in both jobs and she loves working in agriculture. Her children help her with her work.  Firuza buys young calves and fattens them up, then resells them on the livestock market. Now Firuza plans to expand her livestock and farming business. She has applied for a loan to buy several calves and watermelon seeds. The money will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy some young calves and watermelon seeds to expand her business

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband with no children. She has spent three years working as a female hairdresser and beautician at her domicile where she greets her customers with a great smile. Fatmeh started her career at a young age with the intention of increasing the family’s revenues. Currently, she wants to get a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l so as to purchase hairdressing tools. She feels like she is meant to work in such a business and states that she is very happy and looks forward to opening her own beauty salon as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old and married. She has one child. To help her husband, she engaged in a banana production business to earn income. She's been in this business for 15 years already and it helps them a lot in their daily needs. She earns an income of PHP 5,000 each month. She needs a worker for harvesting the bananas to be ready to sell to the market. Recently, she decided to borrow a loan to pay the labor cost for harvesting the bananas so that she can bring them to the market to sell.

Ruth wants for the future to buy a motorcycle to use for transporting the bananas to the market.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for harvesting the bananas.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is aged 27. She is married and they're blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 2,500 daily. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase canned goods, beverages, biscuits, detergent soap, sugar, cooking oil, and coffee. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beverages, biscuits, detergent soap, sugar, cooking oil, and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar and cooking oil to sell to meet her family needs and those of her clients.

loans.name: Moeurt's Group

texts.en: Moeurt has been a rice farmer for 17 years, living in Siem Reap province. He is 37 years old. Feeding pigs to sell is an additional source of income for his family and he can earn about 28,300 KHR per day. In the previous year, his crops did not grow well, so he is now lacking funds to do farming again. That is why he formed a group to apply for a loan with his portion used to pay the plowing fee. He hopes his crops will grow well and provide him with more yields than last year.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is the age of 45. She is the mother of one daughter and a son. Her husband is a green grocer by profession and has sold fresh vegetables from a shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his children and old parents from the income generated through the vegetable shop. Nowadays the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have another source to cope with these needs so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock so that he can sell the maximum amount of vegetables. Therefore, Fozia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more seasonal vegetables.

Fozia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Selvanus

texts.en:
Selvanus is a 40-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income and also has a banana and coffee plantation where he earns an extra income. He admires having a very big farm of cattle but his main challenge is competition from other livestock farmers coupled with prolonged droughts where animals lack water and grass to feed. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Pho's Group

texts.en: Pho, 49, is a married mother of three children who are all in school and living in Mondulkiri province. Cassava farming and working for other farms for a fee have been the sources of her family’s income for 10 years. She can earn about 89,300 KHR per day. Now she does not have enough funds to do the farming, so she decided to lead a group to apply for a loan via VisionFund to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Kakunyu School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Mary. She is the Director of Kakunyu School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kakunyu in Masaka with 400 students. Kakunyu School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kakunyu School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Mary ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mpungwe School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is George. He is the Director of Mpungwe Parents Junior School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mpungwe in Masaka with 650 students. Mpungwe School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Mpungwe School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. George ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: St. Jude School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Mary. She is the Director of St. Jude School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kyabakuza in Masaka with 1,400 students. St. Jude School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Jude School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Mary ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru:
Это прекрасная женщина Лола. Она 38 летняя жительница района Шахритус. Лола на рынке района продает «чакка» и зелень. Она 8 лет продвигает эту деятельность. «Чакка» очень вкусный молочный продукт, который изготавливается  из молока. Все жители республики  покупают «чакка» для салата и пищу. 
Лола замужем и мать двоих детей. У нее одна дочка и один сын. Дочке 18 лет. Сыну 24 лет. Сын женат и они живут вместе отцом и матерью. Лола планирует взять кредит расширить свою работу. За счет кредита она хочет купить молока, больше зелень и аппарат для изготовления «чакка». Лола надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This lovely lady is Lola. She is a 38 year old resident of the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan. Lola sells "chakka," a type of strained yogurt, and herbs at the local market. She has been doing this for 8 years. Chakka is a delicious dairy product made from milk.  All of the residents of Tajikistan enjoy chakka and add it to their salads and other dishes. Lola is married with two children - one daughter and one son. Her daughter is 18 and her son is 24 years old.  Her son is married and they live with Lola and her husband.  Lola plans to take out a loan to expand her business. With the loan she plans to buy milk, more herbs, and a machine for making chakka. Lola is depending on your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk, herbs, and a machine for making "chakka"

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Hoy Roberto sonríe, se siente feliz, entusiasta y sobretodo muy agradecido porque gracias a la incursión de la corporación Interactuar en la zona de tierra personas como él, quienes eran empleados por muy bajo salario pueden crear empresa, gracias a los préstamos y asesorías que dan.

Roberto quien  es padre de una pequeña de tan solo 6 años de edad, quiere iniciar un negocio de gallinas ponedoras, en pocas palabras venderá huevos, primeramente en la región  pero aspira a conseguir algún convenio con una empresa grande que subcontrate este servicio y trabajarle de lleno a ellos.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 200 gallinas ponedoras y alimento para las gallinas.

Quiso ser independiente porque sabe que genera más recursos además tiene una pequeña de 6 años por la cual luchar y trabajar, la consentirá hasta que su salud se lo permita y le prometió que su padre le pagara la educación para que se forme y sea una profesional humilde hija de un campesino.
texts.en:
Today Roberto is smiling. He feels happy, enthusiastic and moreover very grateful because thanks to the visit by Interactuar Corporation to his part of the earth, people like him who are employees with very low salaries, can create a business thanks to the loans and services they offer.

Roberto, who is a father to a 6 year old daughter, wants to start an laying hen business, that is to day sell eggs. At first in his area but he would like to get an agreement with a large company to subcontract to them and provide full-time for them.

With the loan he wants to buy 200 laying hens and food for them. He wants to be independent as he knows it generates more money and he also has the 6 year old to strive and work for. Which he will do as long as his health allows and promises that her father will pay for her education so that she learns and becomes a professional, the humble daughter of a country-person.

loans.use: to start a laying hen business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 23 years old. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

He practices poultry farming and has also started fruit farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chicken and pay for construction of a modern poultry house that will enable him to add more stock to his poultry business.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and pay for construction of a modern poultry house that will enable him to add more stock to his poultry business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Mary, 55 years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 with an aspiration to be trained in order to gain knowledge in economics and social power. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy a calf. This will in the long run help improve her dairy farming productivity; thus with more income to cater for family needs.

She is happy for the support.

loans.use: to buy a calf that will help boost her farming; thus with more income to meet family needs.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 48 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей. Образование среднее, работает санитаром. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Гулмира занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 20 лет назад с собственных сбережений. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры, ее бизнес, на сегодняшний день насчитывает 2 коровы, 35 овец. В совокупности деятельность приносит прибыль в сумме 21,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, улучшение материального и жилищного состояния.
texts.en: Gulmira is 48 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children. She has a high school education and works as a nurse. As a source of income for her family Gulmira also raises livestock, a business she started 20 years ago with her own savings. Thanks to her hard work, She currently has two cows and 35 sheep. In total she brings in 21,000 KGS per month, but this is not enough for a basic standard of living.  Therefore, in order to expand her business, Gulmira turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy more livestock for fattening. With the income she makes Gulmira plans to invest in her business and increase her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: Sros's Group

texts.en: Sros’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sros makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help the group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one child, who does not attend school. She lives at her own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past five years, she has operated a mat weaving sales business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials.

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en: En is aged 49 years old. She is a mother of five children, living in Mondulkiri province. Cassava farming and working for other farms for a fee have been the sources of her family’s income for six years. Due to lack of funds for the farm, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy farming supplies. She wishes to earn more money to fulfill her family’s needs and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Sreythol's Group

texts.en: Sreythol’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreythol makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a taxi driver to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Roze, who is in her late 30s is single with one daughter who is still at school. She has been selling at a genge duka for seven years now.  She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Roze's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase on the genge duka stock to serve more people.  She dreams of taking her children to good schools. 

Roze will share this loan with her loan group, Ununio, which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the genge duka stock to serve more people.

loans.name: Vat's Group

texts.en:
Vat’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Vat is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sambath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Sambath is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 37-year-old divorced man with three children who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He deals in motor vehicle transport and has a taxi with which he earns his daily income. Fred’s business challenges include poor roads that result in constant mechanical breakdowns which are costly for him to repair. He is a very hardworking man.

Fred is requesting a loan to buy land for construction. He hopes to construct a very good residential house for his family.

loans.use: to buy land to construct a house for his family

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a 55-year-old married woman with three children. Her youngest child is 15 and still attending school. For the past 10 years, Tita has owned a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various goods such as cooking oil, eggs, sugar, soap, coffee, soft drinks and many other products. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Tita is requesting a loan to buy rice, soft drinks, and assorted groceries. She will use her loan to augment her daily earnings and bring more customers to her shop. Tita will be able to manage her finances and start to pay her obligations as well as finance the schooling of her youngest child. Tita hopes to become successful in handling her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, and assorted groceries

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Sarin’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sarin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sony's Group

texts.en:
Sony is a rural villager living in Kratie province. She is 58 years old and a mother of eight children; only one of them is in school. Selling grocery items and working for other farms have been her family’s sources of income for forty years. 

Sony earns about 66,700 KHR per day. To fulfill her needs to expand her business, she is now forming a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy more grocery items for resale. Sony hopes to earn more money and to be able to keep sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Ban's Group

texts.en: Ban’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ban makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Geidis

texts.es:
Geidis es un joven que desde los 15 años de edad se convirtió en madre, adquirió una gran responsabilidad y la asumió con madurez, al provenir de una familia humilde tuvo que abandonar sus estudios para dedicarse totalmente a su hijo.

Con el pasar del tiempo fue surgiendo necesidades económicas, el mantenimiento del pequeño que hoy en día tiene 6 años se tornó mas dificultoso, los padres de Geidis le ayudaron a construir unas cocheras y ella con un pequeño capital compro dos cerdos e inicio con la profesión de cría de cerdos, con este negocio ha podido pagar las necesidad básicas de su hijo y el padre se encarga de todo lo relacionado con los gastos del hogar.

Geidis ve buena oportunidad para progresar con el negocio, la falta de capital ha sido su principal enemigo pero ahora con la ayuda que le brindan puede iniciar con un pequeño monto para abastecer sus cocheras.

En resumidas Geidis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para abastecer su cocheras, el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar sus negocio, generar mayores ventas, tener clientes y por ende aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Geidis is a young woman who at the age of 15 became a mother, acquired a great responsibility, which she took on with maturity.  Coming from a family of humble means, she had to abandon her studies to dedicate herself completely to her child.

As time passed, her economic needs increased and taking care of a small child who is now 6 years old turned out to be very difficult.  Geidis's parents helped her to build some stables and she, with a little money, bought two pigs and began the profession of breeding pigs.  With this business she has been able to pay for her  child's basic necessities, and the father takes care of any expenses having to do with the home.

She sees a good opportunity to advance her business, but the lack of money has been her main enemy.  Now with the help that is offered through this loan, she can start with a small amount to increase the numbers of pigs in her stables.

Geidis wants to request a loan for the purchase of pigs to increase the numbers in her stables.  The loan will help her to improve her business, increase her sales, have more customers, and therefore improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to increase the number in her stables.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 46 years old, is married and has five children. She is engaged in an entertainment business (Video Karaoke Bar), which is known in her community for the purpose of relaxing through singing. The business generates income and is able to support the family's daily needs. 

Mary Ann needs financial assistance since her video machine needs to be repaired. She is taking a loan to pay for labor costs in repairing the video k machine so that it can continue to operate, cater to more customers and increase her income. In the future, Mary Ann wants to buy a new machine to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs to repair the video karaoke machine.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Cristian Darwin

texts.es: Criatian esta en sus 23 años de edad, este joven trabajador vive con sus padres y se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de animales. Cristian comenta que termino sus estudios basicos y no pudo continuar ya que vive en una comuidad muy separada de la ciudad donde estan los centros educativos, Cristian desde hace 2 años atrás se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de terneros. Cristian solicita el dinero del credito para comprar terneros y mejorar su negocio. Cristian tiene la aspiacion de seguir trabajando, ser constante en su negocio, comprar mas terneros para obtener mas ganancias y reunir un capital para continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Cristian, at 23 years old, is a young worker living with his parents who works as a laborer and breeds animals.  He comments that he stopped his basic education and could not continue since he lives in a town very far from the city where the schools are.

He has been working as a laborer and has been breeding livestock for the past 2 years.  He is requesting a loan to buy calves to improve his business.  Cristian hopes to continue working, be stable in his business, buy more calves to increase his income, and save money to continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Germania Guadalupe

texts.es: Germania es una joven con muchas aspiraciones, tiene 24 años de edad, Germania comenta que su familia ha salido  adelante por medio de la agricultura y la ganaderia. Germania se dedica a la crianza de ganado y necesita el dinero del credito para comprar una vaca. Germania desea mejorar su negocio, comprando mas ganado y obteniendo buenas ganancias, Germania se encuentra estudiando para hacerse profesora y con el ingreso que le quede de su negocio espera seguir pagando sus estudios.
texts.en:
Germania is a young woman with many hopes, and is 24 years old.  She comments that her family has gotten ahead through agriculture and livestock farming.  

She works breeding livestock and needs a loan to buy a cow.  She would like to improves her business, buy more livestock and have a good income.  She is studying to become a teacher and with her income that she saves she hopes to continue to pay for her education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a 32-year-old single lady with one child living in Masindi-Uganda. She operates a restaurant as her major business and works hard to make it grow. Jennifer's main business challenges are inadequate capital  and high food prices. She dreams of educating her child to university. Jennifer intends to use the loan to buy foodstuffs and drinks for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Rukhshonamo

texts.en:
Rukhshonamo, 51 years old, is from the district of Hamadoni. She is a faithful wife and the mother of 4 children. Rukhshonamo has a talent for sewing women's clothing, having learned this activity with her mother's help. Rukhshonamo has been engaged in this activity for 2 years. In her work, she likes enthusiastic clients more, as she works very hard for them. 

Rukhshonamo needs a loan in order to purchase a new modern sewing machine and fabric. Without these means, Rukhshonamo will not be able to continue her favorite business. She hopes very much for your help.

loans.use: To purchase a new modern sewing machine

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en: Savin’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Savin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Esmeralda Eliseth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja es policía, tiene 2 hijos que aún viven con ella porque son menores de edad.

Esmeralda, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado desde hace 7 años, decidió dedicarse a eso por que ya tenía experiencia gracias a sus padres, los cultivos y el ganado los mantiene en la parte de atrás de su casa, las actividades las realiza con un hermano, porque a su pareja no le queda tiempo.

Esmeralda, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y alimento para el ganado.

Ella sueña con comprar un vehículo, para que se le facilite el traslado de su cosecha cuando la obtenga.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 34 years old, studied until the ninth grade.  She is in a relationship, and her partner is a police officer.  She has 2 children who still live with her because they are still young.

She has worked in agriculture and livestock breeding for the past 7 years.  She decided to do this work because she already had experience, thanks to her parents.  The crops and the livestock she cares for are behind her house.  She works with her brother, because her partner does not have the time.

Esmeralda needs the loan to buy farming supplies and food for her livestock.  She dreams of buying a vehicle, which would ease the transport of her harvest when the time comes.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and food for her livestock.

loans.name: Sreyon's Group

texts.en: Sreyon’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province, Cambodia. Sreyon makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sam Ol's Group

texts.en:
Sam Ol is a rice farmer, living in Kratie province. She is 31 years old and a mother of a small child. Sam Ol has been involved in this business for more than five years and it earns her about 55,200 KHR per day. 

Sam Ol has joined a group of three to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and enable her to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Farid

texts.en:
Farid is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his family in Baku. Since childhood, he has dreamed of becoming a professional banker, and because of that, he decided to go to university to study accounting. 

Farid is now in his second year, but the high cost of living and his brothers' studies prevents his father from paying for his university fees. Farid did not want to give up his dreams and stand in front of these obstacles doing nothing. Therefore, he has requested a loan to help him pay for his university fees and achieve his goals. Please support him.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Ka Oek's Group

texts.en:
Ka Oek is a 25-year-old, married woman who lives in Kratie province. The sources of her family’s income are from cassava farming and working on other farms for income. She has been involved in these businesses for seven years and it earns her about 72,000KHR per day. Due to the depreciated price of cassava, she is now lacking funds to farm again. 

Because of this Ka Oek is now applying for a loan with her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 50-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situation of Palestinians in Lebanon, Ahmad started working in electronics repair 22 years ago to satisfy his family's needs. 

Ahmad has a good reputation in his region and he is well-known for his proficiency in this field. Today, Ahmad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a necessary toolkit which will facilitate his work and help him in providing his customers with better and quicker service.

loans.use: to buy a necessary toolkit which will facilitate his work

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 43 years old, married, and has six children. To help her husband in providing for her children's daily needs, she operates a food-vending business making buco juice. She manages it personally and earns income that helps her family a lot with their financial needs. 

Vicenta aims to increase her income. She decided to take a loan to buy more coconuts to make buco juice so that her sales will increase and her income will increase also.

Vicenta wants for the future to buy a new motorcycle for delivery of her buco juice in the market.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to make buco juice to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a single woman with one child and sells clothes as her source of income. She works hard to see that her business continues operating in the future. She does so with the intention of planning for her only child like any loving parent would do. Her major challenge is the poor road system to marketplaces that poses a high cost of transport.
