Sarah intends to use the loan to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Nicat

texts.en:
Nicat is a 24-year-old university student. He lives with his mother in Baku. He is an example of an ambitious and positive guy. He wishes to graduate to find good work to help his mother with household expenses and to carry responsible from her. 

Lately his mother has faced financial problems and she could not cover Nicat s university fees. Therefore he decided to apply for an educational loan to pay for his university fees and achieve his goals. Please support him.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is a 60-year-old widow who has been working for the past 14 years to raise her only child and make a living. Somaya is a Palestinian who lives in a Palestinian camp.

Somaya sells detergents, shampoo, perfume, and cosmetics to neighbors, relatives, and friends. Her business is going just fine but she dreams of expanding it soon by opening a big shop. To increase her income, Somaya is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her merchandise with new products, such as cosmetics, perfumes, and shampoo suitable for the summer season. This loan is very important to Somaya for it will increase her income and allow her to satisfy her customers' special needs.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new products, such as cosmetics, perfumes, and shampoo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband in purchasing new rickshaw.

loans.name: Sreyroth

texts.en:
SreyRoth, 29, is a mother of a child, living in Kandal province. Factory worker and selling grocery items are the sources of her family’s income for two years and she could earn about 37,000KHR per day. 

Now, she is applying for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner to buy a motorbike to drive her to work. She hopes this loan will help her to go to work on time and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to get her to work on time

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 33-year-old mother of four, who runs a convenience store in order to support her husband in covering the family's increasing needs and expenses.
Mona is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise with new products and items to satisfy her customers' needs.
Mona is willing to develop her business in a well-managed way in order to make sure that she can expand it into a wider shop in the future to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new products and items to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is a father of three children and is aged 38. He wants to provide his family a good living and as a father, he wants to provide his family's daily needs with the help of his wife. 

He is engaged in a sari-sari store business as a source of income for his family. Tomas want to increase his family income. He needs to buy additional goods for sell of his store to increase his store inventory and have more sales for the purpose also to increase his income.

Tomas plan for the future to expand his business and save money out from his business.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for sell, in order to expand his business and save some income

loans.name: Dany's Group

texts.en:
Dany, 26, is a mother of two small children, living in Kampong Cham province. Rice farming is the only source of her family’s income for eight years and it earns her about 41,700KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she leads a group of two to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farming. She hopes to earn more income and have enough consumption to use.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to have more income and have enough consumption to use

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Musarat's husband in purchasing toys for reselling and to meet the demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Shabana's husband in purchasing general store's inventory for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming, which will enable him to start generating income

loans.name: Sron's Group

texts.en:
Sron, 37, has been a rice farmer for more than five years, living in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of three dependent children. 

Due to lack of funds to do farming, she is now leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income and have a better living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees, to earn more income and have a better living condition

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Allah Rkhi's husband in purchasing a moto rickshaw's body and for the fixing of his motorbike.

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en:
Aydin is 22 years old and is in his last year studying finance at the university. He chose this major because he wants to find good work as soon as possible.

Aydin is delaying his last year and graduation because of financial problems that his family has faced. 

Aydin requested an educational loan to cover the tuition fees so that he can complete his education and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fees

loans.name: Vandy's Group

texts.en:
Vandy is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She is 28 years old and a mother of a small child. 

To overcome her family’s hardship, Vandy has grown rice for ten years and earns about 35,600 KHR per day on average. 

Now Vandy is applying for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to increase her average income through expanding this current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Flor De Lirios Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE LIRIOS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teresa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de chocolate y café, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de material escolar, venta de pasancalla (maíz tostado), venta de carne.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teresa es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de material de limpieza; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia ya que conocía la forma de venta de su vecina, es por ello que decide iniciar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material de limpieza por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The credit group, “Flor de Lirios” (The Lily Flower), will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II Focal Center. The group is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Mrs. Teresa serves as president. 

The businesses that the group members carry out are varied: cosmetic sales, chocolate and coffee sales, a neighborhood store, clothing sales, school supplies sales, sales of “pasancalla” (toasted corn) and meat sales. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit a number of small business owners including group member Mrs. Teresa. She says that the group joined Pro Mujer a year ago, receiving an invitation from an advisor of the organization that visited Mrs. Teresa at her home.  

Currently, she has a business selling cleaning materials. She learned the business on her own accord, as she already learned how to sell from her neighbor. So, she decided to start her own independent business. 

The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital by purchasing wholesale cleaning materials that she will acquire from wholesale sellers in La Paz and later sell in markets in El Alto. This form of work allows her to have resources to support her family financially, as she has seven children and is in a common-law marriage. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mrs. Teresa says she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cleaning materials.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 35 ans, Akossiwa est une femme qui a trois enfants à sa charge. Habitant à Adamavo, Akossiwa est une revendeuse de bouillie en parcourant son quartier afin d’avoir une bonne rentabilité. Akossiwa s’approvisionne au marché une fois par mois. Pour commander  des bols de sorgho, Akossiwa sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser sa commande afin d’avoir plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akossiwa is 35 years old, married and has three dependent children. She lives in Adamavo and works as a vendor of porridge. She sells as an itinerant vendor in her neighborhood to obtain a good profit margin. She stocks up at the market once a month. Akossiwa is seeking this loan to pay for her order of sorghum in order to earn a higher revenue and provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy 17 bowls of sorghum.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. 

Parveen is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services from her home. She has been doing this for the past ten years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. 

Parveen has been doing a tailoring business at home for many years with the help of her daughters. She wants to buy two additional sewing machines for her daughters, but she does not have enough cash on hand.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan for her tailoring business so that she can easily buy sewing machines for her daughters. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machines for her daughters.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou, 26, is a mother of a small child who is in school, living in Kampong Cham province. 

To overcome her family’s hardship, Chanthou has grown cassava and rice to sell for eight years and it earns her about 50,000 KHR per day.

Now Chanthou is leading a group of three to take a loan with VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee. 

Chanthou hopes to earn more money and be able to keep sending her child to school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee

loans.name: Santih Pelangi Group

texts.en:
These are the members of “Santih Pelangi” Group who is posing in front of a pig cage. The Group is led by the 53 year-old farmer Nyoman, who is standing far left pointing his two thumbs up and wear a cap at his head. The other farmers in the group are Made, Putu, Ketut, Komang, Wayan, Ketut, Kadek, Made and Wayan. Because Komang were unable to attend at photo-taking process, he were represented by his wife, Ni Nengah, who is holding a piglet. She have agreed to be displayed on Kiva. All of them live in a small village in Sumbawa Besar District, Sumbawa Island, Indonesia. Nyoman has a family with five children. He also is a headmaster of a local Elementary School and member of community society in his village. 

Nyoman has high hopes for his family and he strives to improve his economic conditions. He was also concerned to see many of the poor farmers in his village. He run a small scale rice farming and also have a small pig fattening business. However, he was troubled with the high price of chemical fertilizers. He is deeply concerned to see the pig dung was wasted without further processing and it polluted the surrounding neighborhood with a pungent odor. His farmland also started infertile because of too much receiving chemical fertilizers.

After socialized by YRE and Paroso Mason Group (a local organization, founded by Yayasan Rumah Energi as biogas construction partner) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Nyoman saw the biogas program is a solution of his problem. He saw opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. In addition, he also wants to use bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer for his plants to increase revenue and to reduce soil damage of his farmland. Nyoman feel enthusiastic to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other group members to make it possible.

He have an optimism that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He also hopes that in the future, he can invite the whole farmers in his village to use biogas and also establish bio-slurry related business to create a new job opportunity to his surrounding neighborhood.

loans.use: To build bio-digesters facility and utilize bio-slurry (biogas residues) as organic fertilizers

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 60 years old, married and has five children. To help her husband with the cost of living, she owns and manages a fish vending business which earns her an income of PHP 2,000 per month. This helps the family a lot for their daily needs. 

She wants to increase her family income, so she has decided to take a loan to buy more fish to sell so that she can generate more income.

In the future, Angelita plans to buy a fishing boat of their own for fishing.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and he supports seven family members. 

He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the past 14 years, and it earns him an income of KES10,000 per month. John has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya in order to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance to meet clients' transport service needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children.

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Edwin Javier

texts.es: Edwin cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en venta y elaboración de bisutería, sus inicios fueron en el vecino país de Venezuela, donde trabajó por tres años como vendedor en una empresa de venta de materiales para la elaboración de bisutería.  Al observar lo rentable que era el negocio, consideró que como independiente tendría un mejor porvenir y recibió un crédito de ésta misma empresa para iniciar su negocio,  una actividad parecida, sin embargo él elaboraría bisutería; aretes, pulseras, collares y demás accesorios.   Sus principales proveedores se encuentran en los países, Brasil y Venezuela en donde le ofrecen facilidad de pago o según su flujo de caja compra de contado.  Sus productos son ofrecidos todos los días en el horario de 7 a.m. a 6 p.m. a almacenes,  comerciantes o directamente al comprador final, por la relación de confianza que maneja con sus clientes sus ventas las genera de contado y también ofrece facilidad de pago, por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de piedras de diferentes tonalidades y texturas, nylon, broches, y demás accesorios. Esta inversión disparará las ventas de insumos, su estrategia es comprar volúmenes y ofrecerlos a precios más bajos. Edwin de 34 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos de 2 y 3 años, a quienes desea continuar ofreciendo bienestar.  Su meta a futuro es consolidarse como un distribuidor a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Edwin has 15 years of experience in the sale and production of costume jewelry. His beginnings were in the neighboring country of Venezuela, where he worked for 3 years as a salesman in a company that sold materials for the production of costume jewelry. Seeing how lucrative the business was, he considered that as an independent agent he would have a better future. He received a loan from the same company to start his own business, which is similar in terms of its activity, yet he would actually produce the costume jewelry, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, and other accessories. His main suppliers are located in Brazil and Venezuela, and they offer him the ability to pay in installments or, depending on his cash flow, to pay in full.

His products are offered everyday from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m, to warehouses, traders, or directly to the final consumer. Due to the trust-basted relationship he has with his clients, his sales are payed either in installments or in full. It is for this reason that he is applying for a Kiva loan, which is the first financing he requests from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He would use the loan to invest in the purchasing of stones of different colors and textures, as well as nylon, brooches, and other accessories. This investment will skyrocket the sales of his merchandise. His strategy is to buy in bulk, and so, offer them at lower prices. Edwin is 34 years old, and is the father of two children of ages 2 and 3, to whom he wishes to keep providing for their well-being. His goal is to establish himself as a distributor on a nationwide level.

loans.use: to invest in the purchasing of stones of different colors and textures, as well as nylon, brooches, and other accessories.

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es:
Jorge, de 47 años de edad, está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con su mamá y dos de sus hermanos.

Jorge, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la agricultura y 4 años de trabajar en una panadería; él siembra maíz, ajonjolí y en la panadería trabaja de lunes a sábado, decidió sembrar granos básicos porque siempre lo hizo con sus padres y porque de ahí cubría la necesidad de alimentación para su familia, la parcela donde siembra está a 20 minutos desde su casa y la panadería está a 30 minutos.

Jorge, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar.

Jorge, siempre a querido construir 2 cuartos más en su casa, además desea arreglar el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Jorge is 47 years old. He is single, he doesn’t have children, and he lives with his mother and two of his brothers. 

Jorge has been working in agriculture for 3 years and he’s been working in a bakery for 4 years. He plants corn and sesame and he works in the bakery from Monday through Saturday. He decided to plant basic grains because he always did that with his parents and it fed his family. The parcel where he plants is 20 minutes from his house and the bakery is 30 minutes away.

Jorge needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs in order to plant.

Jorge has always wanted to build 2 more rooms in his house, and he would also like to fix the roof on his house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs in order to plant.

loans.name: Chan Thoeun's Group

texts.en:
Chan Thoeun, a 40-year-old mother of two school children is living in Kampong Cham province. To support her family’s way of life, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland and for 20 years has worked as a construction worker. Through this business, she can earn about 46,700KHR per day. Now she lacks the funds to buy fertilizer for farming, so she leads a group to apply for a loan via VisionFund. 

Chan Thoeun hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has been engaged in raising and selling of hogs for almost 8 years. She is a 42-year-old married woman with a 9-year old child residing in Panglao, Bohol.  Her husband earns a living by providing motorcycle transport services.

She is asking for a loan to buy an additional 3 piglets, pig feed and supplements. With these, Jocelyn would be able to boost her hog raising business. She would also increase the quantity of hogs which will help augment her income. Thus, she is able to provide her family with good food and continue financing the education of her child as well.

Jocelyn would like to expand her hog raising business to build a bigger piggery in the near future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, pig feed and supplements.

loans.name: Maria Patricia

texts.es:
María quien es una mujer de 35 años de edad, que vive junto a su pareja con la que tiene 3 hijos está cerca de gran un gran paso en su vida y tú la puedes ayudar para que su gran sueño de tener una empresa se vuelva realidad.

María quiere tener una cría de gallinas esta necesidad surgió pro querer mejorar las condiciones de vida y porque no sabe cuándo su pareja le falte y ella deba hacerse cargo de los gastos.

María tiene una incapacidad que le imposibilita hacer grandes esfuerzos, pero esto lo hace por su familia, un motivo más que suficiente para realizar cualquier esfuerzo que sea necesario.

Con el préstamo solicitado María comprara 200 pollos y adecuara un espacio para construir un galpón.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old. She lives with her partner, with whom she has 3 children. She is nearing a big step in her life and you can support her so that her big dream of having a business can become reality.

María wants to have a business raising chickens. This came about because she wants to improve her living conditions and because she doesn’t know when her husband could pass on and she might need to  take charge of the expenses. 

María has a disability that prevents her from doing hard physical work, but her family helps her out. This reason is more than good enough to achieve what is necessary.

With the loan that María requested, she will buy 200 chickens and fix up a space for her chicken coop.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens and fix up a space for her chicken coop.

loans.name: Srey Oun's Group

texts.en:
Srey Oun, 28, is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school.  They all live in Kampong Cham province. For 10 years, rice farming and working on other farms for wages have been the sources of her family’s income, earning her about 48,000 KHR per day on average. 

To expand her current business, she is now leading a group to take a new loan from VisionFund in order to buy seeds and pay a plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can earn more income and have the ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kisshen

texts.en: Kisshen is 19 years old and from Dipaculao, Aurora, in the Philippines. She is now taking up a Bachelor of Science in Medical Laboratory Science. She chose this course because she believes that she will be able to use what she learns to help her fellow countrymen. She wants to finish college to help her family financially. Her financial difficulties are what drives her to study harder. Because her parents cannot fully support her studies, Kisshen wants to take out an education loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) so she can reduce her financial burden. She is hopeful that KIVA lenders will approve her loan.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 35-year-old woman. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan. The financial condition of her family is not good. She is the mother of four children; all of her children are young and one of them goes to school.
 
Her husband is a tailor by profession; he sews only gent’s clothes. He has been sewing gent’s clothes for many years and feeding his whole family. He had been using an outside service to overlock the garments and paying a healthy amount for this service. Now he wants to buy an overlock machine of his own but he does not have the finances to purchase the machine. He wants to buy an overlock machine thorough his savings but he is short some amount of money. Therefore, Sakina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he can buy a new overlock machine to enhance his tailoring work.

Sakina is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann, 20 years old, is from Dipaculao, Aurora. She is taking a BS in Information Technology. She is determined to finish college so she won’t be her parents’ responsibility in terms of financial support and she chose this course because she believes that there are a lot of opportunities in the fast-growing industry of technology. Since her parents cannot fully finance her schooling, Rose Ann wants to avail an education loan of PHP 10,000 from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 50 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living and help her husband, she engaged in a transport business to earn an income and provide her children's daily needs. As a part of the motorcycle maintenance and to be able to continue catering to her passengers, she needs financial assistance to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle. That's why she availed a loan of PHP 28,000.

Edna wants, in the future, to buy a new motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Top Model Group

texts.en:
Berlita is the featured borrower of Top Model Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Berlita is a 50-year-old married mother of one child. She is working hard to improve her living family's living conditions. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business selling perfumes and clothes. Berlita is the first lady on the left of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Willen is the lady in the middle and Josephine is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to start a new business selling perfumes and clothes

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine, a pharmacist by profession, lives in Artik town with her husband, parents-in-law and two school-age children (her 14-year-old daughter and 10- year-old son). Marine works at a local pharmacy, and her time after work fully belongs to her children and family. They cultivate wheat and work hard to gather a good harvest. 

To help her family to develop their farm and gather a good harvest, Marine has applied for this loan. It will help her to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation so her family's farm will grow. 

Because Artik town and the whole Shirak region are considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Marine's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

Marine and her family members hope to receive your support and develop their farm.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation so her family's farm will grow

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda who previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for spare parts and renewal of franchise agreement of her tricycle unit. She also has a small general store by her house as is seen on her photo. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.  

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Part of the loan will be used to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her three children who are at Elementary school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Melinda hopes that her two business will continue to grow. she prays that God will help them to prosper as she continues to work hard for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a 39-year-old married father of two children. Five years ago, he started working in furniture painting in an attempt to increase his income to satisfy his family's increasing living costs.

Elie is trying hard to improve his family's living conditions, thus today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. This loan is very important to Elie for he believes that education is the only way for his children to build a better future.

Elie hopes to improve his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of covering his family's needs and expenses.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
A 50-year-old mother of two children, Horn is living in Kampong Cham province. Selling grocery items has been the only source of her family’s income for more than five years and it earns her about 48,500 KHR per day on average. 

To expand her current business, she is now leading a group to take a loan via VisionFund to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to earn more money and have the ability to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Teimurazi

texts.en:
Teimurazi, who is 30 years old and a married man, lives in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He has a wife and both work to the local open market. Teimurazi is a guard and his wife is a sales lady. They get a small income and find it hard to have financial stability. 

They decided to start own business and open a store in this previously-mentioned market. They have already found a place to start their trading activity. Now, he needs financial support to purchase a stock of baby clothing and to have money for working capital to start his retail business. 

Teimurazi has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The new business will be profitable he thinks, as the place is always crowded with clients and people in his country mostly purchase there all kinds of products for further sale. The loan will greatly assist Teimurazi as his income will significantly increase. He will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: To start trading baby clothing.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Her name is Ramona. She is 45 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Nicanor, an overseas foreign worker, they have three children of which one is in High School, one in Elementary Level and the other one is already working. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her children to school. 

Ramona operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 800 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings is their source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Ramona hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life. She strives to hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To  pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec son enfant. Enyonam est âgée de 30 ans et œuvre activement pour apporter sa contribution à l’épanouissement de sa famille. Enyonam vend des pagnes dans sa localité et grâce à son commerce, elle trouve une épargne pour favoriser son mari à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Enyonam s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfice, Enyonam veut commander des pagnes et demande ce crédit pour atteindre ses objectifs et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Enyonam is a married woman who lives in Baguida with her child. She is 30 years old and works actively to support her family's development.

Enyonam sells pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] in her area, and thanks to this business she earns enough to support her husband with the family expenses.

Enyonam procures her goods twice a month at a market. With the goal of earning more profits, she is seeking a loan so that she can order more pagnes and promote her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seven lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Richard est père de famille très actif, travailleur et dynamique, conscient de ses responsabilités et devoirs vis à vis de sa famille. Il est marié et a six enfants, les trois derniers vont encore à l'école et les autres sont déjà mariés et n'habitent plus avec lui et sa femme.
Il dirige une épicerie, il a commencé avec une petite gargote en 1994, et au fur et à mesure il ne cessait pas d'améliorer et de développer l'activité.
Sa femme gère une petite élevage et quelques cultures vivrière. Son désire de réussir lui pousse encore de continuer à lutter et à avancer, il y a encore trois enfants à charge. "Beaucoup de combat restent à faire, il ne faut pas s'arrêter là" dit-il.
texts.en:
Richard is a very active family man, who is a a hard worker and dynamic. He is conscious of his responsibilities and duties to his family. He is married and has six children. Three of the children are still in school, while the others are already married and no longer live with him and his wife.

Richard runs a grocery store, and he started a small restaurant in 1994. He has never stopped improving and developing his business.

His wife raises some livestock and grows some crops. 

Richard's desire to succeed pushes him to keep advancing. He still has three children to take care of.

He says, "The fight still remains, it does not stop here."

loans.use: to buy three sacs of rice, one sac of sugar, two boxes of candles, four boxes of soap, and two drums of cooking oil

loans.name: Pierette

texts.fr:
Mère de famille et mariée, Pierette a 36 ans.Son mari dirige une petite épicerie. Quant à elle, livraison des marchandises générales auprès des épiceries constitue l'activité génératrice de revenu de Pierette. Elle a démarré cette activité en 2008. Actuellement, elle fait la livraison auprès des trentaines de petites épiceries dans les bas quartiers et elle est encours de négociation avec d'autres nouvelles.
Son objectif est de diversifier et d'augmenter les quantités des marchandises à vendre ainsi qu'acquérir beaucoup de clients pour procurer beaucoup de bénéfices.
Elle a trois enfants qui vont tous à l'école actuellement. Son désire est de les faire réussir dans leurs études et de leur offrir une meilleur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Married and mother of a family, Pierette is 36 years old. Her husband runs a small grocery store. As for her, she works delivering general goods to grocery stores as a way to earn a living. She started this business in 2008.

Currently, she makes deliveries to thirty or so small grocery stores in poorer areas, and she is in negotiations with other new stores. Her goal is to diversify and increase how much stock she sells as well as to acquire new customers an earn more profits.

She has three children in school. She wishes to make them succeed in their studies and offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy boxes of matches, candles, pencils, notebooks, noodles, candy, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sopha’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sopha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy water filters to provide safe drinking water at home for their families.

loans.name: Hammann

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Hammann. From Ruiru village market in Kenya, Hammann is a husband and a father of a 3 year old child. He is passionate about cows and finds great enjoyment in dairy farming, something he does for a living. 

On a 0.5 acre land, Hammann keeps 2 dairy cows and has over 30 trees planted. His future objective is to increase the number of cows and also the size of his land. 

Hammann is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. Besides the obvious benefits, the newly acquired dairy cow will help utilize the excess fodder he keeps his property. Products such as milk will be sold while by products such as dung will be used as manure for the maize and banana crops he grows.
 
Additional income from this investment will help elevate the quality of life Hammann's family is living.

loans.use: to buy an additional dairy cow, to utilize excess fodder available on his property and thus to provide more income for his family

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Masindi-Uganda and is married with four children. She is fifty years old and deals in produce(selling of dry food stuffs mainly maize,beans and rice). She is a hard working woman and loves her business. She hopes to have all her children educated from good school the only special gift she can offer to them.

Regina wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 53-year-old married mother of one child. She started twenty four years ago working as a hairdresser to help her husband in covering the increasing needs of their family. Sanaa is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her region. She learned this career since her childhood, and she gained throughout the years a lot of experience and professional skills.
 
Today, Sanaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy comfortable hair styling chairs to provide her customers with better service. On the other side, she wants to buy curtains for her house.

Sanaa hopes to develop her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy comfortable hair styling chairs for her salon and to buy curtains for her house

loans.name: Et's Group

texts.en:
Et’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Et makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water in their homes for their families

loans.name: Chek's Group

texts.en:
Chek, 40, is a mother of three children, living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, her family’s living is depending on growing cassava on 3.5 hectares farmland for fifteen years and she could earn about 52,500KHR per day on average. 

To fulfill her needs of expanding her business, she is now leading a group to take a loan with VisionFund to rent more farmland, 2 hectares, and buy pesticide for her farming. She hopes she could earn more income and ability to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to rent more farmland, 2 hectares, and buy pesticide, to earn more income for her old house renovation

loans.name: Pompeya

texts.en:
Pompeya lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. She raises and sells pigs to earn for a living. She is a married woman with two children ages 11-19 year old respectively. She has been raising hogs for 3 years now. Her husband earns a living by being a mason. She needs additional funds to continue operate her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to purchase piglets and feeds. These are very useful tools that would improve the way Pompeya raises hogs. It will enable her to sell quality pigs and able to augment her income. With these she would be able to provide the needs of her children.

Pompeya is consistent in handling her hog raising business to be come more sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds, to augment her income and provide for the needs of her children

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She is aged 28 years and the mother of two small children. 

Nowadays, her family’s living is depending on growing rice on 3 hectares farmland for more than five years. Due to lack of funds, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund,  to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

She hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, to be able to expand her rice production business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives in Poqr Mantash village of the Shirak region with his mother, wife and son. His second son serves in the army. 
Vardan's mother is elderly and retired and despite her age, helps Vardan with farming activities. 
They keep two cows, calves and cultivate potatoes, carrots and onions.
 
All their needs are invested in the farm, so the harvest they gather will be increased and Vardan will be able to gather more income for his family. He has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support him to purchase potato seeds for land cultivation to develop the farm and gather more income for the family. 

Because the region where Vardan's village is located is considered poor and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Vardan's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

Vardan hopes to receive lenders' support and improve his farming business.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds for land cultivation to develop the farm and gather more income for his family

loans.name: Chan Roeurn's Group

texts.en:
Chan Roeurn is living in Battambang province, she is aged 29 years old and the mother of three children.  Two of them are in school, while the other one is too young to attend school. 

She is a teacher and rice farmer for ten years and these businesses earn her about 82,000KHR per day to support her family. Now she is leading a group of three to take a loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees. 

She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees, in order to improve the standard of living for their families

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат, 44 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Рахат- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она делает ремонт на заказ, красит, шпаклюет. Клиентов привлекает, размещая рекламу в газете. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). В этом году Рахат решила сделать ремонт у себя дома, поэтому и  обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Свои доходы Рахат планирует вкладывать в расширение своего дела и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Rahat, 44, is married and has two children. She has vocational secondary education. She earns a living by renovating, painting and puttying. She gets new clients by advertising in the local paper. Her monthly income is about 16,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Rahat decided to renovate her own home this year. Therefore she is requesting a loan of 150,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy construction materials. This will expand her business and consequently improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for renovating her house
